text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **REFRIGERATOR ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1¾ cups warm water (110-115°F)
- 2 packages active dry yeast
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1/4 cup soft butter or margarine
- 6 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon butter, melted
<|steps|>
Pour warm water into a large bowl (rinsed with hot water) and check temperature to ensure it's warm, not hot.
Sprinkle yeast over water, add sugar and salt, and stir to dissolve completely.
Add egg, soft butter, and 3 cups flour; beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth.
Gradually add 1 cup flour, beating hard after each addition, then work in remaining 2 cups flour with hands until smooth and elastic.
Brush the top of the dough with melted butter, cover with a double thickness of plastic wrap or a damp towel, and let rise in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until doubled in bulk.
Punch down dough and refrigerate, punching down once a day for 1-3 days.
Shape into rolls, place in greased pans, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 400-425°F for 15-20 minutes, depending on roll shape and size.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
- ¾ cup molasses
- 3 eggs, well-beaten
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and brown sugar, then blend in molasses.
Add eggs.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together; blend nuts into dry ingredients.
Add dry ingredients gradually to the molasses mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
For the frosting, melt a 6 oz package of chocolate pieces over hot water, cool, then blend with ½ cup dairy sour cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla; spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON FILLING FOR CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 egg yolks or 4 whole eggs
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 4 lemons
- 1 tbsp fine corn meal
- White icing, for topping
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup corn syrup
- 1 cup water
- 3 squares chocolate
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 0.75 cup sweet milk
- Pinch of salt
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 0.67 cup milk
- 1 heaping cup whole pecans
<|steps|>
Cook egg yolks, butter, sugar, lemon juice, and corn meal in a double boiler until thick.
Spread between layers of white cake.
Cover cake with plain white icing.
**CHOCOLATE SAUCE**
Boil sugar, corn syrup, and water without stirring until it threads or forms a soft ball in cold water.
Remove from heat, add chocolate, vanilla, and salt.
Slowly stir in evaporated milk.
**CARAMEL SAUCE**
In an iron skillet, shake sugar and butter until brown, without stirring.
In a separate vessel, cook 1.5 cups sugar, milk, and salt until it coats a spoon.
Add hot browned sugar mixture to the milk mixture.
Remove from heat and beat well.
**PRALINES**
Boil brown sugar and milk, stirring often, until it forms a soft ball in cold water.
Remove from heat and beat until it thickens.
Add pecans.
Drop onto buttered paper to form rounds about 3 inches in diameter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PETTICOAT TAILS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup soft butter
- 1 cup sifted confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon flavoring (vanilla, almond, wintergreen, or rose)
- 21/2 cups sifted plain flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Mix butter, confectioners' sugar, and flavoring thoroughly with hands.
Sift flour and salt together, then stir into the butter mixture.
Press and mold into a long roll about 2 inches in diameter, wrap in wax paper, and chill until stiff (several hours or overnight).
Slice into 1/8- to 1/16-inch thick slices with a thin, sharp knife.
Place slices slightly apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KING RANCH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 fryer or hen
- 1 doz. tortillas
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 can cream mushroom soup
- 1 can cream chicken soup
- 1/2 can tomatoes and green chilies
- 1/2 can (soup) chicken broth
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in small amount of water, lightly salted, until tender.
Bone chicken and cut into pieces.
Blend soups, tomatoes and green chilies, and chicken broth until smooth.
Into a 2 1/2 quart greased casserole, place a layer of chicken, 1/2 of the tortillas, cut into pieces, 1/2 of the onion, 1/2 of the cheese and 1/2 of the sauce.
Repeat the layers, ending with cheese.
Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for 1 hour.
Serves 8 or 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 stick butter
- 1 can asparagus tips
- 2 tbsp. cheese, grated
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. almonds, sliced, opt.
- 2 cup. canned sweet peas, drained
- 2 hard boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 can mushroom soup, undiluted
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Use part of butter to grease casserole dish.
Make layers of peas, asparagus, egg slices and cheese in casserole.
Add soup and milk.
Cover with cracker crumbs and almonds.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. butter
- 1 lb. sugar
- 10 eggs
- 1 lb. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 1 lb. raisins
- 1 lb. currants
- 1 lb. candied cherries
- 1 lb. candied pineapple
- 1 lb. pecans
- 1/2 cup. wine or brandy
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, baking powder, and spices, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in fruits, nuts, and wine or brandy.
Pour into greased loaf pans, bake at 275°F for 2 1/2-3 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LIVERS ON TOAST POINTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds chicken livers
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 8 slices salt pork or country bacon
- 2 medium onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 pound thin-sliced mushrooms
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 5 cups chicken broth
- 2 or 3 drops Kitchen Bouquet (optional)
- Pinch of nutmeg
- 11/2 cups sherry
- 1 cup sour cream
- Toast points
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cut chicken livers in half and toss in 1 cup flour mixed with 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Sauté salt pork or bacon until very crisp, remove, drain on paper towels, and keep warm.
Sauté livers in the drippings until cooked, then remove and drain on paper towels.
Sauté onions in the same pan until almost tender, add mushrooms, and cook until tender; remove and add to livers.
Add 2 tablespoons butter to the drippings, stir in ¾ cup flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until flour begins to brown (avoid burning).
Add chicken broth and stir until smooth and thickened.
If the sauce looks pale, add Kitchen Bouquet for color.
Season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper to taste.
Return livers, onions, and mushrooms to the sauce and heat through.
Stir in sour cream and sherry.
Serve on toast points, sprinkle with crumbled pork or bacon, and dust with paprika.
Note: Can be prepared ahead, reheated at serving time (add cream and sherry then), or frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE CREAM PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gal. cucumbers
- 2 cup. salt
- 2 Tbsp. alum
- Boiling water (enough to cover)
- Vinegar (for syrup)
- Sugar (for syrup)
- Spices (for syrup)
<|steps|>
Pour boiling water over salt and cucumbers, let stand overnight.
Drain, cover with clear boiling water, let stand overnight, drain.
Make syrup of vinegar, sugar, and spices, bring to boil, pour over pickles.
Let stand for 3 days.
On the fourth day, reheat syrup, pack pickles in jars, pour hot syrup over pickles, and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEA BUSTER'S FROZEN SUMMER FRUIT MAYONNAISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 teaspoon gelatin
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup diced canned pineapple
- 3/4 cup halved stoned sweet cherries
- 3/4 cup shredded plum
- 3/4 cup chopped pecans
- Lettuce hearts, for serving
- Mint sprigs, for garnish
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in fruit juice for 5 minutes, then dissolve over steam.
Add dissolved gelatin to mayonnaise.
Stir in pineapple, cherries, plums, and pecans.
Transfer to an ice tray and pack in equal parts ice and salt, chilling for 2 hours, or freeze in a refrigerator.
Serve on lettuce hearts, garnished with mint sprigs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE SPREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound cottage cheese
- 2 squares Philadelphia cream cheese
- 3 avocados, mashed to a paste
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 triangle Roquefort cheese
- Mayonnaise, as needed
- Paprika, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Parsley, to taste
- Onion juice, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cream cottage cheese and Philadelphia cream cheese in a garlic-rubbed bowl.
Soften with seasoned mayonnaise (paprika, Tabasco, Worcestershire, parsley, onion juice, salt, pepper).
Beat lemon juice into avocado paste, then add to the cheese mixture.
Optionally, add chopped nuts.
Let the mixture set overnight.
Serve as a dip or on Melba toast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 cup. coconut (for frosting)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Stir in coconut.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For frosting, boil sugar and water to soft ball stage, beat with coconut, spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon and nutmeg
- 1 1/2 cup. cooking oil
- 3 cup. plain flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. pure vanilla
- 3 cups thinly sliced apples, cut up real fine
- 1 cup nuts, cut up
<|steps|>
Mix the ingredients.
Fold in apples and nuts.
Pour into tube pan and bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHIPPED CREAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup. whipping cream
- 3 cup. flour
- 2 sticks butter
- 3 cup. sugar
- 1 tbsp. pure vanilla flavoring
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and beat.
Add cream and flour alternately.
Add vanilla.
Pour into greased tube pan and bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
May be iced or not.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED SUMMER SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 small yellow squash
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp brown sugar
- Bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash squash, cut lengthwise, and scoop out insides.
Place squash pulp and onion in a pressure cooker with a small amount of water; pressure cook for 5 minutes.
Remove lid, place squash shells on a cooking sheet, and salt insides.
Mix pulp with butter, salt, and brown sugar.
Fill shells with pulp mixture and top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE STRAWS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 1 cup shortening
- 1 tbsp ice water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp red pepper
<|steps|>
Cut shortening into flour, salt, and paprika until thoroughly mixed.
Add ice water and knead to a smooth consistency.
Roll out dough, sprinkle with grated cheese, paprika, and red pepper.
Roll up and work cheese mixture into dough with hands.
Roll into a thin sheet, cut into narrow strips, and bake in a slow oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TWENTY FOUR HOUR SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cherries, halved, pitted and drained
- 2 cup. diced pineapple, drained
- 2 cup. white seedless grapes
- 2 cup. tiny marshmallows
- 1/4 cup. slivered almonds, toasted lightly
- 2 eggs
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 cup. light cream
- 1 cup. heavy cream
- 2 tbsp. sugar
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until light.
Add sugar, light cream, and lemon juice.
Cook in double boiler until smooth and thick, stirring constantly.
Let cool.
Whip heavy cream and fold into above mixture.
Mix lightly with fruit, nuts and marshmallows.
Chill 24 hours.
Do not freeze.
Serve in lettuce cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KARO COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. Karo syrup
- 1 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1/4 cup. butter, melted
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix syrup, sugar, eggs, coconut, butter, and vanilla.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into very hot, well-greased muffin molds.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 4 egg yolks
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 can asparagus (with liquid)
- 1 pint whipping cream
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 1/4 pound almonds
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1 tablespoon onion juice
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a double boiler, stir in flour, and mix thoroughly.
Add asparagus liquid, stirring constantly until thickened.
Pour the mixture over lightly beaten egg yolks, stirring continuously.
Return to the double boiler and cook until the eggs are done.
Add dissolved gelatin, salt, pepper, paprika, onion juice, and lemon juice.
Cut up asparagus and, once the mixture is cool, fold in asparagus, almonds, and whipped cream.
Ensure nuts are cold before adding.
Pour into a mold and chill until set.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can green beans, drained
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 2 lbs. beef or lamb
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. diced carrots
- 1 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. peas
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add beans and soup, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with mashed potatoes and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
**STEW**
Cut meat in cubes, brown in fat.
Add salt, pepper, onion, and water, simmer 1 1/2 hours.
Add carrots, potatoes, and peas, cook 30 minutes.
Mix flour with water to make paste, stir in to thicken, cook 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb old cheese, grated
- 0.25 lb butter
- 1 cup flour
- 1 egg white
- Few shelled pecans
- Paprika, to taste
- Red pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Cream butter, then mix with cheese.
Sift flour, paprika, red pepper, and salt; combine with butter and cheese mixture.
Form into a roll, wrap in oiled paper, and chill.
Slice, place half a pecan on each biscuit, glaze with egg white, and bake in a moderate oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pints strawberries
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup flour, for pastry
- 0.5 cup lard
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking powder
- 4 tbsp boiling water
- Whipped cream, for topping
- 10 macaroons
- 1 pint cream
- 4 oz sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Grated rind of 0.5 lemon
- 1 small wine glass sherry or Madeira
- Pinch of cinnamon
- Almond flavoring, to taste
- 0.5 cup lard
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup molasses
- 0.67 cup hot water
- 2.5 cups sifted flour
- 1.5 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp ginger
- 0.25 tsp cloves
- 0.25 tsp salt
- Whipped cream, for serving
<|steps|>
Wash and stem strawberries, mix with sugar in a bowl.
For pastry, combine flour, lard, salt, baking powder, and boiling water; chill thoroughly.
Roll out pastry as thin as possible and bake until brown on the back of a pie tin.
Place sweetened berries in the baked pastry shell and top with whipped cream.
**SYLLABUB**
Mix sugar, lemon juice, lemon rind, cinnamon, sherry, and a few drops of almond flavoring in a large bowl.
Stir until sugar dissolves, then add cream and whip to a froth.
Arrange macaroons compactly on the bottom of a deep dish.
Skim froth from syllabub and place on macaroons, continuing to beat and skim until all is froth.
Store in a cool place for at least 12 hours before serving.
**GINGERBREAD**
Cream lard, butter, and sugar until smooth.
Add egg and mix thoroughly, then stir in molasses.
Alternate hot water with flour sifted with baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and salt.
Place in a greased and floured shallow loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F.
Serve warm or cold with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLE SLAW SOUFFLÉ SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 package lemon-flavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash of pepper
- 2 cups finely chopped cabbage
- 2 tablespoons minced green pepper
- 2 tablespoons minced onion
- 1/4 teaspoon celery seeds
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in hot water, add cold water, mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, and pepper; beat with an egg beater until well blended.
Pour into an ice tray and freeze for 15-20 minutes until firm about 1 inch from edges but soft in the center.
Turn into a bowl and beat with an egg beater until fluffy.
Fold in cabbage, green pepper, onion, and celery seeds.
Pour into a ring mold and refrigerate until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORNED BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 onions, chopped
- 1 cup. cheese grated
- 1 pkg. noodles, cooked
- 1 can corned beef broken
- 2 slices bread, toasted
- 1/2 cup. bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp. butter
- 1 can mushroom soup, heat
- 2 tbsp. bacon drippings
<|steps|>
Cook onions and pepper in bacon fat till tender.
Cook noodles according to directions on package.
Add cheese to hot soup.
Combine all ingredients in casserole, folding in corned beef.
Top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Yield: 10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OLD FASHIONED EGG CUSTARD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 tbsp. flour
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/3 stick butter
<|steps|>
Place sugar and flour in a bowl.
Add eggs and butter and mix well.
Add milk and beat for 1 minute.
Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake in 400 degree oven for 25 minutes or until firm.
Makes one 8" pie.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER SNAPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. molasses
- 1 egg
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar, add molasses and egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls, roll in sugar, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **YELLOW CUPCAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/4 cup. sifted cake flour
- 3/4 cup. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 2 eggs, unbeaten
- 1/4 cup. shortening
<|steps|>
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
In large bowl sift flour with sugar, baking powder and salt.
Add shortening, milk and vanilla.
Beat 2 minutes.
Add eggs; beat 1 minute.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI CON CARNE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRUNSWICK STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3-lb chicken
- 1 tbsp salt
- Few peppercorns
- 1 carrot
- 2 celery ribs with leaves
- 1 onion
- 1.5 quarts water
- 1 can tomatoes
- 3 medium onions, sliced thin
- 6 medium potatoes, sliced thin
- 1.5 cups fresh lima beans or 1 pkg frozen
- 2 cups fresh white corn or 1 can cream style
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tsp sugar
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Steam chicken, salt, peppercorns, carrot, celery, onion, and water until chicken is very tender.
Strain stock, shred chicken, and return to stock.
Add tomatoes, potatoes, onions, lima beans, and seasonings.
Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add corn and cook 10 minutes longer.
Serve on split cornbread for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
- 1/4 cup green pepper, chopped
- 1 tablespoon minced onion
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups thin cream
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 2 beaten egg yolks
- 21/2 cups diced cooked chicken
- 2 tablespoons finely cut pimento
<|steps|>
Lightly brown mushrooms, green pepper, and onion in butter.
Add flour and blend, then add cream and seasonings.
Cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Stir some of the hot mixture into egg yolks, then add to remaining hot mixture and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add chicken and pimento.
Serve on pastry shells or toast cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED YAMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sweet potatoes, about the size of a pint jar
- Water, as needed
- Butter, for dotting
- Sugar, for sprinkling
- Whole pods of okra, tops on
- Water, to cover
- Melted butter, for serving
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Peel and thickly slice sweet potatoes, about 0.5 inch.
Place in a casserole and add enough water to half fill the dish.
Dot with butter and sprinkle heavily with sugar.
Bake in a moderate oven until done.
**OKRA**
Boil okra pods in enough water to cover until tender.
Pour melted butter over okra, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 pts. fresh strawberries (save out 12 nice ones for garnish, slice the rest)
- 1 egg plus 1 egg yolk, beaten
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla (save 1/2 for whipped cream)
- 1 1/2 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 3/4 cup. soft butter
- 2 cup. vanilla wafer crumbs (reserve 2 tsp. for top)
- 3 cup. powdered sugar, save 2 tbsp. for cream when whipped
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add beaten egg and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Consistency should be pourable, but not watery. If mixture seems too thick, set the bowl in a pan of hot water and stir until thin enough to pour.
Put half the wafer crumbs on bottom of pan, a square pan of about 2 quart capacity is about right.
Pour half the cream mixture over the crumb layer, add half the berries, then half of whipped cream (repeat layers).
Sprinkle reserved crumbs on top.
This dessert should be served partially frozen. If you put it in the freezer for 1 hour, it will be perfect.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY CHICKEN & RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. (scant) cooked rice
- 1 cup. chicken stock
- 2 cup. cooked chicken, chopped
- grated cheese
- 4 hard cooked eggs, sliced
- 1 can cream mushroom soup
<|steps|>
Place rice in casserole, add stock.
Cover with layer of chicken and egg slices.
Pour soup over this.
Top with cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until hot or bubbly.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILLED VEGETABLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice or vinegar
- 1 large orange
- 1 medium size grapefruit
- 1 cup. shredded cabbage
- 1 Tbsp. thinly sliced scallions
- 1 large can asparagus
- 3 or 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 2 cup. sweet milk
- 4 Tbsp. flour or cornstarch
- Lump of butter or oleo
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Cracker or bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jell-O and salt in hot water, add lemon juice.
Section orange and grapefruit, reserve juice, add water to juice to make 1 c., add to Jell-O mixture with cabbage and scallions.
Pour into 1 1/2 quart ring mold, chill until firm.
Serve with mayonnaise.
**CASSEROLE ASPARAGUS WITH CHEESE SAUCE**
Make white sauce: cook milk, flour, butter, salt, and pepper until fairly thick, remove from stove, add cheese, stir until melted.
Layer asparagus in casserole, slice eggs over asparagus, cover with sauce, top with crumbs.
Bake until heated through.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEWY COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. brown sugar, packed firm
- 1 cup. pecans, coarsely chopped
- 3/4 cup. sifted flour
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 tbsp. butter
<|steps|>
Sift flour, soda, and salt.
Melt butter in saucepan, add sugar, blend.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Beat well.
Add remaining ingredients.
Pour into pan 8x13".
Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees, or until done.
Cut while warm into squares before removing from pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 1 cup cold chicken stock
- 1 cup boiling chicken stock
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 1 cup chicken, chopped
- 1 cup celery, chopped
- 0.33 cup pickle, chopped
- 2 tbsp pimento, chopped
- 2 tbsp green pepper, chopped
- 0.5 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatine in cold stock, then add boiling stock.
Add lemon juice, mayonnaise, whipped cream, chicken, celery, pickle, pimento, green pepper, and salt, one at a time.
Congeal in a mold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO JUICE APPETIZER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt., 14 oz. can tomato juice
- 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt (savor salt)
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 lb. butter
- 1 qt. water
- 1/2 cup. best vinegar
- 1 large onion (or 2 small)
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 1 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1/2 cup. tomato catsup
- 2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 Tbsp. black pepper
- Salt to taste
- Green Bell pepper (optional)
- Celery (optional)
- Hot red pepper (optional)
- 1/2 cup. cooking oil
- 3 small garlic cloves, chopped fine
- 1 large onion, chopped fine
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 2 No. 2 cans tomatoes, strained
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/3 tsp. pepper
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 cup. butter or margarine
- 1 minced clove garlic
- 4 tsp. flour
- 2/3 cup. water
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 6 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1/2 tsp. dried thyme
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Chill well before serving.
**BARBECUE SAUCE**
Bring all ingredients to boiling point, then simmer for 30 minutes.
If using, cook celery and Bell pepper until tender, add to mixture, bring to boil.
**ITALIAN SPAGHETTI SAUCE**
Pour oil into fryer or pan, add garlic and onion, fry until brown.
Add ground beef, brown it.
Add tomatoes and seasonings, cover, cook until sauce is thick, about 2 hours.
Serve over cooked spaghetti, sprinkle with grated cheese.
**LEMON BARBECUE SAUCE**
Mix minced garlic with butter in a saucepan, stir in flour.
Add remaining ingredients, cook, stirring until lightly thickened.
Cool, use as a baster when barbecuing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MILK PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 oz whole milk
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 2 lumps ice
- 1 jigger 86-proof whiskey
- Grated nutmeg, for garnish
<|steps|>
Combine milk, sugar, ice, and whiskey in a cocktail shaker or blender.
Shake well until thoroughly mixed.
Pour into an 8-ounce tumbler.
Sprinkle grated nutmeg liberally over the top and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED APPLE RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large red apples
- Brown sugar, as needed
- 4 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
Cut each apple into 3 or 4 slices.
Fry slices in a skillet with 4 tablespoons butter for about 10 minutes.
Turn slices, sprinkle with brown sugar, and cover.
Cook until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OYSTERS ROCKEFELLER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 dozen medium-size oysters, in shells
- 1 tbsp chopped onion or shallot
- 2 tbsp chopped parsley
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.25 cup cooked spinach
- 0.33 cup bread crumbs
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- Chopped bacon, optional
<|steps|>
Remove oysters from shells, wash shells, and replace oysters.
Mix onion, parsley, seasonings, and half the butter; spread on oysters.
Top with finely chopped spinach and bread crumbs.
Dot with remaining butter and brown in a hot oven for about 10 minutes.
Serve with quartered lemon, on a greased oven-proof platter or individual casseroles if not using shells.
Add chopped bacon if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED TURKEY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 turkey (10-12 lbs.)
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Rub turkey with butter, season with salt and pepper.
Place in roasting pan, add water, cover.
Bake at 325°F for 3-4 hours, basting occasionally, until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cakes cream cheese
- Cream, as needed
- 2 tbsp green pepper, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp pimento, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp onion, finely chopped
- Garlic, to taste, optional
- Cayenne pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- 1 cup finely chopped almonds
- Mayonnaise, for serving
<|steps|>
Soften cream cheese with cream to the consistency of cake batter.
Add green pepper, pimento, onion, optional garlic, cayenne, salt, and almonds.
Place in a mold and chill until congealed.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON DELIGHT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf or patties, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WALNUT PEACHERINO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. lemon gelatin
- 1 3/4 cup. boiling water
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
- 3/4 cup. syrup from canned peaches
- 1/3 cup. chopped walnuts
- 12 to 16 cling peaches
- 4 maraschino cherries, cut up
- 1/2 cup. commercial sour cream or cottage cheese, well drained
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, add lemon juice and peach syrup.
Cool until slightly thickened, add walnuts, peaches, cherries, and sour cream or cottage cheese.
Pour into mold, chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARABIAN STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. lamb
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. diced carrots
- 1 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 cup. water
<|steps|>
Cut lamb in cubes, brown in fat.
Add onion, carrots, potatoes, raisins, salt, pepper, cinnamon, and water.
Simmer 1 1/2 hours until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JACK POT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. round steak, ground
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 pkg. noodles
- 1/4 cup. chopped ripe olives
- 2 tbsp. fat
- 1 can tomato soup
- 2 tbsp. Worcestershire
- 1 #2 can cream style corn
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
<|steps|>
Brown meat in hot fat.
Add onions, cook until golden.
Add to tomato soup, water and noodles.
Cook until noodles are tender, stirring frequently.
Season to taste with salt and black pepper.
Add corn, olives, 1/2 cup of cheese and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour into greased 2 quart baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Serves eight.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Mix flour, powdered sugar, and butter, press into 8x8 pan, bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
Beat eggs, sugar, lemon juice, baking powder, and salt, pour over crust.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes, dust with powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cooked chicken, deboned
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Sauté onion and green pepper, add soup, salt, and pepper.
Mix chicken, spaghetti, and sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ELIZABETH HENDERSON'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound butter
- 1 pound sugar
- 12 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 4 dozen macaroons
- 1/2 cup bourbon whiskey
- 1 1/2 squares Baker's chocolate
- Lady fingers, for lining
- Whipped cream, for serving
- Chopped nuts, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar in an electric beater for 20 minutes.
Beat egg yolks for 6 minutes, then beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Soak macaroons in bourbon whiskey.
Add egg yolks and melted chocolate to the butter-sugar mixture.
Stir in vanilla and fold in egg whites.
Line an ice box cake pan with lady fingers.
Layer macaroons and chocolate mixture alternately until the pan is filled.
Refrigerate for 6 hours.
Serve with whipped cream and garnish with chopped nuts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. E. L. MOTHERSHED'S NUT & DATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 eggs, separated
- 3 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 1 quart pecans
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon allspice
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 cup water
- 1 package figs or 1/2 pound cherries
<|steps|>
Sift flour, cloves, cinnamon, allspice, and baking powder together.
Cream sugar and butter, then add egg yolks and beat slowly.
Add water, then mix in dates, pecans, figs or cherries, and the dry ingredients.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a loaf pan and bake at 300-350°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET POTATO PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 lbs raw sweet potatoes
- 0.33 lb butter
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice and rind of 1 lemon
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup rice
- 0.25 cup salt
- Water, for boiling
- Melted butter or gravy, for serving
<|steps|>
Grate potatoes carefully, then heat with butter over a slow fire.
Remove from heat, add egg yolks beaten with sugar and lemon.
Mix well and fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake in a deep pan in a moderate oven for about 1 hour.
**RICE**
Wash rice through at least 4 waters.
Bring a gallon of water with salt to a rolling boil.
Slowly pour in rice and boil for 20 minutes or until tender.
Drain in a colander, then rinse under cold water for 1 minute.
Place colander in an oven or warmer to dry out.
Serve with melted butter or gravy, or piled in the center of a platter surrounded by chicken or meat.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK EYED PEAS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb fresh black eyed peas
- 0.25 lb streak o'lean (salt pork)
- Salt, to taste
- Water, to cover
- Small piece of red pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Shell, wash, and drain peas.
Place salt pork in a pan with water and bring to a boil.
Add peas, salt, and optional red pepper.
Cook slowly until tender, about 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AMBER PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. raisins
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 1 tsp. cloves
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- just a little nutmeg
- 2 tbsp. butter, melted
- 1 tbsp. vinegar
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients, adding vinegar last.
Bake in pie shell about 30 minutes or until done at 350 degrees.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOUNDER FLORENTINE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg frozen chopped spinach
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 tbsp butter or margarine
- 1 12-oz pkg frozen flounder fillets, thawed
- 0.5 cup undiluted evaporated milk
- 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 0.5 tsp dry mustard
- Dash nutmeg
- Paprika, optional
- Red pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook spinach as label directs; season with salt, pepper, and butter.
Place spinach in a greased 10x6x2-inch baking dish.
Arrange fillets on spinach.
Mix milk, cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and nutmeg; pour over fillets.
Bake 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Sprinkle with paprika and red pepper if desired, for 3-4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRESSED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (4-pound) hen
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 4 hard-cooked eggs
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 cup hot chicken stock
<|steps|>
Boil hen until tender, remove from bones, grind, and season with salt and pepper.
Combine ground chicken with chopped celery, hard-cooked eggs, and mayonnaise; mix well.
Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes, then add to hot chicken stock and stir until dissolved.
Pour gelatin over chicken mixture and mix.
Pour into a large mold and refrigerate until set.
Unmold and garnish as desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD SUPREME**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup. Pet evaporated milk
- 1/2 cup. fresh peaches, cut in small pieces
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 6 marshmallows, cut in eighths
- 1/2 cup. drained, crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup. thinly sliced banana
- 1/4 cup. sliced maraschino cherries
- 1 - 3 oz. pkg. softened white cream cheese
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
<|steps|>
Chill evaporated milk until ice crystals form around edges.
Mix peaches, 2 Tbsp. sugar, marshmallows, pineapple, banana, and cherries, let stand.
Stir cream cheese with 2 Tbsp. sugar and mayonnaise until smooth.
Whip chilled milk with lemon juice until stiff, fold in fruit and cheese mixtures.
Freeze in tray without stirring until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAM CHESS PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1/3 cup oleo
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 9-inch unbaked pastry shell
<|steps|>
Cream sugar, oleo, and flour in a bowl.
Add eggs one at a time, beating thoroughly.
Mix in evaporated milk, vanilla, and salt.
Pour into the unbaked pastry shell.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 350°F and bake for 30 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE-CHEESE ICE BOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup graham cracker crumbs
- 4 tablespoons melted margarine or butter
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon plain gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 3 egg yolks, slightly beaten
- 1 cup crushed pineapple (with syrup)
- 1 teaspoon grated lemon peel
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 cup cottage cheese
- 1 cup butter
- 1 2/3 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- Pinch of salt
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 5 tablespoons milk
<|steps|>
Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted margarine, and 2 tablespoons sugar; press into a 9-inch pie pan, reserving 3 tablespoons crumbs for topping.
Chill crust thoroughly or bake at 375°F for 8 minutes; cool.
Soften gelatin in cold water and set aside.
In a cold double boiler, combine egg yolks, pineapple, lemon peel, lemon juice, and ¼ cup sugar; cook over hot water, stirring until thick.
Add gelatin to the hot mixture, stirring until melted; remove from heat.
Put cottage cheese through a wire strainer and add to the hot mixture.
Heap filling into the chilled crust, sprinkle with reserved crumbs, and chill for 3 hours.
**PLAIN POUND CAKE**
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together; add alternately with milk to the creamed mixture.
Add vanilla.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHERRY WINKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/3 cup drained and chopped maraschino cherries
- 21/2 cups crushed corn flakes
- Additional maraschino cherries, quartered, for topping
<|steps|>
Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together.
Blend butter, sugar, eggs, milk, and vanilla; beat well.
Mix wet ingredients into dry ingredients, then add dates, pecans, and chopped cherries.
Drop by rounded teaspoons into crushed corn flakes, toss lightly to coat, and form into balls.
Place on a baking sheet and top each with a quarter of a maraschino cherry.
Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. water
- 2 egg yolks
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 baked pie crust
- Meringue (2 egg whites, 1/4 cup. sugar)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add water, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add lemon juice and butter, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with meringue, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERMUDA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small cauliflower
- 0.5 large Bermuda onion
- 0.5 cup stuffed olives
- 0.67 cup French dressing
- 1 head lettuce
- 2 cups Roquefort or Blue cheese
<|steps|>
Separate cauliflower into flowerets and slice thin crosswise.
Slice Bermuda onion and separate into rings.
Slice stuffed olives and place all in a bowl with French dressing.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Break up lettuce and crumble cheese.
Toss all together lightly just before serving.
Serve from the bowl and pass extra French dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Meringue (2 egg whites, 1/4 cup. sugar)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add coconut, butter, and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with meringue, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT CHICKEN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. chopped chicken
- 3/4 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tsp. chopped pickle
- 1/4 cup. salad dressing
- Salt and pepper
- Butter or margarine
- 12 slices bread
<|steps|>
Heat salad dressing in small saucepan over low heat.
Add chopped chicken, celery, pickles, salt, and pepper.
Place hot filling between buttered slices of bread or serve as toasted sandwich.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. yellow cake mix
- 1 pkg. strawberry Jello
- 4 eggs
- 2/3 cup. Wesson oil
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 cup. strawberries and juice
- **Strawberry Frosting:**
- 1 pkg. conf. sugar
- 2 tbsp. soft butter
- the remainder of the strawberries and juice, 10 oz pkg.
<|steps|>
Beat eggs well and add oil.
Mix Jello with dry cake mix.
Beat into eggs and oil.
Add water and strawberries.
Makes 3 or 4 layers.
Bake at about 250 degrees.
Can bake it in 2 angel food cake pans.
For frosting, mix together and spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERNIE'S BUTTERMILK CARAMEL CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, buttermilk, butter, and baking soda in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and pecans.
Beat until thick and creamy.
Pour into a buttered pan and let cool.
Cut into squares when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WATERMELON PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs watermelon rind
- Alum water, for soaking
- Clear water, for soaking
- Weak ginger water, for boiling
- 3 cups sugar
- 1 pint vinegar
- 1 tbsp cloves
- 1 tbsp whole spice
<|steps|>
Prepare rind and soak in alum water for 24 hours.
Soak in clear water for 5 hours.
Drain and boil in weak ginger water until tender.
Drain, then pour a syrup of sugar, vinegar, cloves, and whole spice over rinds.
Bring to a hard boil and seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **S.J.'S SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes, pulpy
- 1 box lemon jello
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- Dash of salt
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
- 1/2 cup diced celery
<|steps|>
Break tomatoes into a pulp, add vinegar, salt, and celery seed; cook to boiling point.
Pour hot tomato mixture over jello to dissolve.
Cool, then add diced celery.
Pour into individual molds and chill until congealed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup quick-cooking oatmeal
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 egg
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup cooking oil
- 1 cup sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
<|steps|>
Soak oatmeal in buttermilk for 1 hour.
Add egg and beat well, then add sugar and cooking oil.
Sift flour with baking powder, salt, and baking soda; add to oatmeal mixture and stir just enough to mix well.
Fill well-greased muffin tins two-thirds full.
Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
Note: Muffins keep fresh for several days and can be made ahead and warmed as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups white sugar
- Water, to cover
- Pinch of cream of tartar
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Freshly grated cocoanut
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, water, and cream of tartar until it forms a soft ball in water.
Cool in the pan, then stir slowly until it creams.
Add vanilla, form into balls, and roll in grated cocoanut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC - PRESSED CHICKEN RING MOLD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 small No. 2 cans tomato juice
- Garlic salt or garlic vinegar, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion salt, to taste
- Celery salt, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Brown sugar, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 2 cups cubed cooked chicken
- 1 cup sliced hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 3/4 cup sliced olives
- 2 tablespoons unflavored gelatin
- 1 cup chopped celery
- Avocado dressing, for serving
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak gelatin in cold water, then dissolve in heated (not boiled) tomato juice.
Season with garlic salt, lemon juice, onion salt, celery salt, Tabasco, Worcestershire, brown sugar, and paprika to taste.
Pour into a ring mold rinsed with cold water or greased with Wesson oil.
Refrigerate until firm.
For the pressed chicken, dissolve 2 tablespoons gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water, then add to 2 cups boiling chicken cooking liquid.
Season and chill until syrupy.
Mix with cubed chicken, sliced eggs, lemon juice, olives, and celery.
When the mixture begins to set, pour over the set tomato aspic in the ring mold.
Refrigerate until fully set.
Serve on lettuce with avocado dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into a hot, greased pan.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH ONION SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 medium onions
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 quart consommé
- 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Rounds of toast
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 clove garlic (optional)
<|steps|>
Slice onions thinly and brown in butter.
Add consommé, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, and simmer until onions are tender.
Optionally, rub the casserole or toast with a cut clove of garlic.
Pour soup into an earthen casserole or individual casseroles.
Arrange toast rounds at the bottom, pour soup over, and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Place under a broiler until the cheese melts and browns. Serves 4.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PICKLED BEETS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 303 can sliced beets
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup vinegar
- 1/2 cup beet liquid
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon prepared mustard
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, vinegar, beet liquid, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice; heat to boiling.
Pour over sliced, cooked beets.
Let stand in the refrigerator for 24 hours before serving.
**SAUCE FOR FROZEN CAULIFLOWER OR BROCCOLI**
Combine mayonnaise and mustard.
Pour over cooked, drained cauliflower or broccoli in a 1-quart casserole.
Place under a broiler for 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HARVARD BEETS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. beets
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 cup. lemon juice or vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cook beets until tender, slice or quarter.
Cook cornstarch, sugar, water, lemon juice, and salt together for 5 minutes.
Pour sauce over beets, let stand for a few minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX DESSERT (OR SALAD)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 tablespoon (1 pkg) gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 box Dream Whip
- 1 No. 3 can sliced pineapple, chopped
- 1 can Morgan dark sweet cherries
- 1/2 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until thick, add sugar and lemon juice, and cook until thick (like pie filling).
Dissolve gelatin in cold water, then stir into the egg mixture; set aside to cool.
Prepare Dream Whip according to package instructions.
Chop pineapple, cherries, and pecans.
Fold fruit, nuts, marshmallows, and Dream Whip into the cooled egg mixture.
Pour into a large pan and chill for at least 24 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RHODA'S EGG PLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- 3 tablespoons salt
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon celery salt
- 1/2 teaspoon onion salt
- 1/2 cup grated cheese
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Cut off the rind and slice eggplant crosswise into 1/2-inch slices.
Sprinkle salt between slices and let stand for 1 hour.
Rinse in cold water, cut into dices, and boil in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain.
Melt butter, blend in flour and milk, and cook until the cream sauce thickens, stirring constantly.
Add paprika, celery salt, onion salt, and cheese, mixing until the cheese melts.
Add eggplant to the sauce.
Pour into a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with bread crumbs mixed with melted butter.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons salad oil
- 1 (2-pound) chicken fryer
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 pound mushrooms
- 1/4 teaspoon savory
- 1/8 teaspoon thyme
- 1 clove garlic
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1 medium green pepper, cut in strips
<|steps|>
Cut chicken into serving pieces and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Heat oil in a skillet, place chicken skin side down, and brown for 20 minutes on both sides.
Add lemon juice, water, savory, thyme, and garlic; cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add mushrooms, onion, and green pepper; cook for 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OLIVE AND BACON SQUARE**
<|ingredients|>
- Finely chopped stuffed olives
- Finely chopped hard-boiled eggs
- Cream cheese, as needed
- Sliced bread (1 1/2-inch squares)
- Bacon squares
<|steps|>
Blend chopped olives and eggs with enough cream cheese to hold together.
Spread thinly on bread squares.
Cover each with a bacon square.
Broil until bacon is crisp and bread is toasted.
Optionally, freeze before baking, following the same layering method as anchovy tricorns.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINK PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large 46-oz. can pineapple juice
- 2 cups boiling water
- 2 pkgs. strawberry jello
- 6 cups cold water
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 can frozen orange juice
- 1 can frozen lemonade
- 1 qt. ginger ale
<|steps|>
Add boiling water to jello.
Stir until dissolved.
Add cold water and juices.
Add ginger ale just before serving.
Garnish punch bowl with slices of lemon or orange.
Place a bunch of plastic flowers in center of each slice and let float on top of punch.
Serves 35 to 40.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE SOUFFLÉ**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 squares Baker's chocolate
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 3 egg yolks
- 3 egg whites
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler.
Stir in flour, then gradually add milk, stirring until thickened.
Add sugar and salt, then cool slightly.
Beat egg yolks and stir into the chocolate mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture with vanilla.
Pour into a buttered baking dish and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT SALAD WITH TOPPING**
<|ingredients|>
- **Salad:**
- 2 packages orange jello
- 31/2 cups hot water
- 16 marshmallows, cut fine
- Liquid from apricots
- 1 large can peeled apricots, cut and drained
- 1 (7 oz) can crushed pineapple, drained
- Liquid from pineapple
- **Topping:**
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 heaping tablespoon cornstarch
- Dash of salt
- 1/2 cup apricot juice
- 1/2 cup pineapple juice
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 1/2 pint whipped cream
<|steps|>
**Salad:** Dissolve jello in hot water, cool, and add marshmallows, apricots, pineapple, and their liquids.
Pour into 8 individual molds and chill until set.
**Topping:** Combine sugar, cornstarch, salt, apricot juice, and pineapple juice; cook until thick.
Add butter, let cool, then fold in whipped cream.
Pour topping over set jello and keep cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED RICE WITH ALMONDS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons salad oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 2 cups boiled rice (can be cold)
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1/2 cup blanched almonds, split lengthwise
<|steps|>
Cook onion, green pepper, garlic salt, and pepper in salad oil for 5 minutes.
Add rice, soy sauce, and almonds; mix well.
Steam until thoroughly heated.
Note: Can be prepared in advance and reheated; good with sweet and sour spareribs, chicken, or shrimp, and easy for buffet-style serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON-COCONUT COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup flaked coconut
<|steps|>
Cream butter, add sugar, and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Add egg and grated lemon rind; beat well.
Sift flour and salt together, then stir into the creamed mixture.
Blend in flaked coconut.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 325°F for 15-20 minutes until lightly browned around the edges.
Remove from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPANISH PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown chops in skillet, remove.
Sauté onion and green pepper in skillet.
Return chops, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper.
Cover, simmer 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY PECAN CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box white cake mix
- 1 box strawberry Jello
- 1 cup. Wesson oil
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup. frozen strawberries
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 box conf. sugar
- 1/2 cup. drained strawberries
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1/2 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Mix cake mix and Jello together dry.
Add oil, milk and eggs one at a time and beat until smooth.
Combine other ingredients.
Bake in 3 layers at 350 degrees.
Cream sugar and butter, adding other ingredients.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JEW CAKES A LA HOLLY SPRINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dark brown sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp cinnamon
- 1.5 tbsp allspice
- 3 tsp baking powder
- 1 heaping cup chopped black walnuts or pecans
- 0.75 cup citron, finely chopped
- 5 cups flour, approximate
- Boiled icing, for coating
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, eggs, cinnamon, allspice, baking powder, walnuts, and citron.
Gradually work in flour until dough can be rolled out, avoiding too much flour.
Roll to medium thickness and cut into 2-inch rounds.
Bake in a very moderate oven, watching to prevent browning.
Ice each with thin boiled icing to keep soft and hold flavor.
Store in tins.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE DRESSING FOR GAME OR FOWL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tbsp cooking fat
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 1 quart chicken stock
- 1 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 egg
- Chopped giblets, optional
<|steps|>
Melt cooking fat in an iron skillet and add washed, dried rice.
Stir over heat until rice is light brown.
Add onion, green pepper, and chicken stock.
Cook slowly until rice is tender, adding hot water if too thick.
Just before removing from heat, add whole egg and optional giblets, stirring well.
Use as stuffing or serve with fowl.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart sweet milk
- 1 cup shortening
- 1 scant cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 2 yeast cakes
- 1 quart flour (plus additional to make stiff dough)
- 1 teaspoon sugar (for yeast)
<|steps|>
Scald milk, then add melted shortening and sugar. Cool to lukewarm.
Dissolve yeast cakes in warm water with 1 teaspoon sugar, then add to the cooled milk mixture.
Let the mixture stand for 2 hours until doubled in size (use a large pan).
Sift flour with salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
Add the flour mixture to the yeast mixture and beat with an electric beater until a light batter forms.
Add enough additional flour to make a stiff dough.
Store in the refrigerator and use as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP COCKTAIL WITH TOMATO SHERBET**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 stalk celery, cut into small pieces
- 1 green pepper, cut into small pieces
- 1 cucumber, unpeeled and grated (strained)
- 1 bunch spring onions, chopped very small
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons horseradish
- Chopped parsley (optional)
- 1 jar Roka cheese
- 1/2 cup chopped spring onions
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped peppers
- Chili sauce, to taste
- 1 pound shrimp
- Parsley, for garnish
- Lemon slices, for garnish
<|steps|>
Mix tomatoes, celery, green pepper, grated cucumber, spring onions, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise and horseradish, and add to the tomato mixture. Optionally, add chopped parsley.
Freeze the mixture in a refrigerator to make tomato sherbet.
For the cocktail sauce, cream Roka cheese with mayonnaise, then add chopped spring onions, celery, peppers, and chili sauce.
Season the sauce with horseradish, Worcestershire, Tabasco, salt, and pepper.
Add shrimp to the sauce.
Fill coupette glasses with tomato sherbet, pour shrimp cocktail sauce over, and garnish with parsley and lemon slices.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomato juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 1 large piece celery, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- Small piece garlic
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp pickling spice
- 1.5 envelopes gelatine
- Cold water, for soaking
- Chopped olives, optional
- Pecans, optional
- Celery, optional
- Shrimp, optional
<|steps|>
Boil tomato juice, sugar, vinegar, celery, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and pickling spice for 10 minutes.
If too thick, add a little water.
Strain and, while hot, add gelatine soaked in cold water for 5 minutes.
Serve plain after chilling, or add chopped olives, pecans, celery, or shrimp as it begins to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OKRA AND TOMATOES CREOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb okra, diced
- 2 tsp fat or bacon grease
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 small clove garlic
- 1 tsp minced parsley
- 1 tsp salt
- Red pepper, to taste
- 1 can tomatoes, mashed through a sieve
<|steps|>
Place diced okra in a skillet with hot grease.
Add onion, green pepper, garlic, parsley, salt, and red pepper.
Cook for about 20 minutes until slightly brown.
Add mashed tomatoes and simmer slowly for about 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. EASON'S ICED PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart large sour cucumber or dill pickles
- 3 garlic buttons
- Sugar, as needed
<|steps|>
Slice pickles and garlic buttons thinly and place in a large bowl.
Pack pickles in sugar, covering with 1/2 inch of sugar.
Cover and let stand until the sugar melts, creating a crisp pickle.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORNED BEEF PATTIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can corned beef
- 1/2 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
<|steps|>
Mix corned beef, potatoes, egg, onion, and pepper.
Shape into patties.
Fry in hot fat until browned on both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACKBERRY ACID**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 lbs blackberries
- 2 quarts boiling water
- 5 oz tartaric acid
- White sugar, 1 lb per pint of juice
<|steps|>
Add boiling water to blackberries and let stand for 48 hours.
Drip juice without squeezing.
Add tartaric acid to juice.
Measure juice and add 1 lb sugar per pint.
Let stand until sugar dissolves, then bottle.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR CURED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 ham (8-10 lbs.)
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 tsp. cloves
<|steps|>
Place ham in roasting pan, add water, cover.
Bake at 325°F for 3-4 hours.
Mix brown sugar, mustard, and cloves, spread over ham, bake 30 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 ham
- 2 cups flour
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1 tsp ground cloves
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp black pepper
- Water, as needed
- Whole cloves, for scoring
- Brown sugar, for rubbing
- Crumbs, for rubbing
<|steps|>
Mix flour, brown sugar, cloves, allspice, and black pepper with enough water to make a stiff dough.
Roll out thin, like pie crust, and wrap the ham completely.
Bake in a slow oven for 30 minutes per pound.
Remove crust and skin, score the fat side, and stick in whole cloves.
Rub with brown sugar and crumbs, then brown in the oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE O'BRIEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup diced green pepper
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups uncooked rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 cup chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook green pepper in butter until tender.
Add rice, chicken broth, and salt; heat to boiling and stir once.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 14 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and toss lightly with pimiento.
Serve hot.
Note: Rice keeps well in the refrigerator, reheats easily, and can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cake flour
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 12 egg whites
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. almond extract
<|steps|>
Sift flour and 1/2 c. sugar.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and salt until foamy, gradually add remaining sugar, beat until stiff peaks form.
Fold in flour mixture, vanilla, and almond extract.
Pour into ungreased tube pan, bake at 375°F for 35-40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEA TOAST STRIPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons anchovy paste, sardine paste, or deviled ham
- 2 tablespoons horseradish butter
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion
- 1/2 teaspoon chopped parsley
- Buttered toasted bread strips
- 1 package Roquefort cheese
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- Toasted bread
<|steps|>
Cream together paste, horseradish butter, lemon juice, onion, and parsley.
Spread on buttered toasted bread strips.
**CANAPÉ**
Mix Roquefort cheese, butter, and chopped nuts.
Spread on toasted bread and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PRALINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon white corn syrup
- 1 tablespoon oleo or butter
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 11/2 cups pecans
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, buttermilk, baking soda, and corn syrup in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat until the mixture forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat, add oleo and vanilla, and beat until frothy.
Add pecans and spoon onto waxed paper to form 8-10 pralines.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POWDERED SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 21/4 cups flour
- Dash of salt
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- ¾ cup chopped nut meats
<|steps|>
Cream butter and powdered sugar.
Add flour, salt, vanilla, and nuts; mix well.
Using a teaspoon, place small amounts (about the size of a marble) on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 14-17 minutes.
Cool, then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS WITH CHESTNUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (12 oz) white asparagus
- 1 can regular celery soup
- 1 can water chestnuts, sliced
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Oleo or butter
- Cracker crumb topping
<|steps|>
In a buttered 1-quart casserole, layer white asparagus, celery soup, and sliced water chestnuts alternately.
Sprinkle cracker crumbs on top and dot with oleo or butter.
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes until bubbling hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in dates, nuts, and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE DROP COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 1/2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and cocoa.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE SWEET POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cooked potatoes
- 1 tall can evap. milk
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. vanilla
- 2 sticks marg.
- 3 cup. sugar
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 tbsp. lemon
<|steps|>
Pour into unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350 to 375 degrees until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. lean beef
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 medium onion
- 1 cup. diced celery
- 2 cup. diced carrots
- 2 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. canned tomatoes
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1 cup. cold water
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Cut beef in 1-inch cubes, brown in fat in heavy kettle.
Add salt, pepper, onion, and enough water to cover meat, simmer 2 hours or until nearly tender.
Add celery, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and sugar, cook 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Mix flour with cold water to make a paste, stir into stew to thicken, cook 10 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. molasses
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup. butter, melted
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix molasses, sugar, eggs, and butter, stir in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER ALE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tbsp. gelatin
- 2 tbsp. cold water
- 1/2 cup. boiling water
- 1/2 cup. ginger ale
- 2 tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup. sliced peaches or pears
- 1 cup. orange sections
- 1/4 cup. fresh strawberries, sliced
- 1/4 cup. grapes, halved or
- 1/2 cup. diced pineapple
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Add boiling water, ginger ale, lemon juice and sugar.
Cool, then add fruits.
Pour into a 1 quart mold or 8 1/2 cup individual molds and chill 6 to 8 hours or overnight.
Makes 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 cups water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup white corn meal
- Large piece of butter
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 2 egg whites, well beaten
<|steps|>
Bring water and salt to a boil, then gradually stir in corn meal.
When smooth, add butter, egg yolks, and sweet milk.
Mix well, then add well-beaten egg whites.
Pour into a greased baking dish and bake in a moderate oven for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CAULIFLOWER WITH ONION RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium cauliflowers (or 2 packages frozen)
- 11/2 cups water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons flour
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup grated yellow cheese
- 1 can fried onion rings
<|steps|>
Divide cauliflower into florets and cook until just tender; drain and save stock.
Add enough stock to evaporated milk to make 2 cups.
Make a sauce with 4 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons flour, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and the 2 cups stock-milk mixture.
In a 1½- or 2-quart casserole, layer half the cauliflower, half the cheese, half the sauce, and half the onion rings; repeat layers.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes until very hot and bubbly.
Note: Can be made several hours or a day ahead and refrigerated until 30 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **1860 POTATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 large Irish potatoes
- Salt, for boiling
- 1 tbsp butter
- Black pepper, to taste
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp chopped green pepper
- 0.5 cup finely chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 0.5 cup chow-chow pickle
- 2 tbsp mayonnaise
- Green pepper slices, for garnish
- Egg slices, for garnish
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil potatoes in salted water until done, then mash.
Add butter and beat until light.
Add vinegar, sugar, green pepper, celery, onion, eggs, chow-chow pickle, and black pepper; blend well.
Add mayonnaise and mix.
Arrange green pepper slices and egg slices on top.
Trim the edge of the bowl with parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- Juice of 6 lemons (cut up and put in punch)
- 1 pt. canned pineapple juice
- 1 pt. canned grape juice
- 4 1/2 cups sugar
- cherries (optional)
- 2 gal. water
- crushed ice
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Serve with crushed ice.
Serves 30.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE DELIGHT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. soda
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. water
- 2 sticks butter
- 1 stick butter
- 6 tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 tbsp. cocoa
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup. chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and flour.
Heat butter, cocoa and water to boiling.
Pour over dry ingredients and mix.
Add buttermilk, soda, eggs and vanilla.
Mix well.
Bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees (it might take a little longer because the mixture will be soupy).
Makes large loaf cake.
**ICING**
Mix butter with cocoa and milk.
Heat to boiling and remove from heat and add powdered sugar.
Mix well and add vanilla and nuts.
Pour over warm cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED SATIN PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt. apple juice
- 10 bottles 7-Up
- 2 pts. cranberry juice cocktail
<|steps|>
Fill two trays with 7-Up and freeze until firm.
Mix together apple juice and cranberry juice cocktail.
Just before serving add the remaining 7-Up.
Pour into punch bowl over frozen 7-Up.
Serves 35.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT JULEP**
<|ingredients|>
- Sugar, 0.5 inch per glass
- Water, to dampen
- Finely crushed ice
- 2 sprigs fresh mint per glass
- 0.5-1 jigger bourbon per glass
- Grated nutmeg, for sprinkling
- 12 eggs, separated
- 1.5 pints whiskey
- 2 pints cream
- 1 pint sugar
- Nutmeg, for sprinkling
<|steps|>
Place sugar in each glass and dampen with water.
Pack glass with crushed ice, placing mint sprigs inside the sides.
Add bourbon and sprinkle with nutmeg.
Stir lightly to frost the glass and serve immediately.
**EGGNOG**
Beat egg yolks well, then gradually add sugar, continuing to beat.
Add whiskey a little at a time.
Add 1 pint unbeaten cream, then stiffly beaten egg whites, stirring well.
Whip remaining 1 pint cream and stir in.
Chill overnight, then shake nutmeg on top of each cup before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups orange juice
- 1 cup pineapple juice (or any canned fruit juice)
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons grated lemon rind
- 2 cups water
- 8-10 cloves
- 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 stick cinnamon
- Ginger ale, wine, or bourbon (optional)
- Maraschino cherries, for garnish
- Maraschino juice (optional)
<|steps|>
Combine orange juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, lemon rind, water, cloves, nutmeg, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan.
Boil for 5 minutes, then strain.
Optionally, add ginger ale, wine, or bourbon for flavor, and Maraschino juice if desired.
Serve very hot, garnished with a Maraschino cherry in each glass.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BUTTER BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
- 1 tbsp shortening
- 0.33 cup sugar
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 2.5 tsp baking powder
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 cup milk
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 cup chopped dates
<|steps|>
Cream peanut butter and shortening, then add sugar and beat well.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Add flour and milk alternately to creamed mixture.
Add vanilla.
Dredge dates with flour and add to mixture.
Bake in a greased loaf pan at 350°F for 1 hour, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 3 cups milk
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 1 pint cream
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- Dash of salt
- 1 can yellow peach halves
- Sugar, for peaches
- Whiskey or brandy, for flaming
<|steps|>
Cream eggs, sugar, and flour together.
Gradually stir in hot milk and cook over boiling water until thick and smooth, stirring constantly.
Cool the mixture, then add cream, vanilla, and salt.
Freeze in a hand freezer to make 3 pints.
Place yellow peach halves in a pan, sprinkle generously with sugar, and cook until the syrup is moderately thick.
When ready to serve, place hot peaches on a heat-proof dish, pour over hot syrup, and sprinkle with sugar.
Pour several tablespoons of whiskey or brandy over the peaches, light with a match, and serve while flaming.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LITTLE PECAN PIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (3 oz) package cream cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 cup flour
- 1 egg
- 1 cup light brown sugar
- Dash of salt
- 1 tablespoon vanilla
- 2/3 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Let cream cheese and margarine soften at room temperature, then cream together and gradually add flour.
Chill dough in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Take small portions (about 1 teaspoon) of dough and press into small ungreased muffin tins to form shells.
For the filling, lightly beat egg, then add brown sugar, salt, vanilla, and nuts.
Spoon filling into pie shells, filling about 2/3 full.
Bake at 325°F for 12-15 minutes.
Cool in tins for about 10 minutes before removing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and shortening, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.75 cup evaporated milk
- 1 pkg lime Jell-O
- 0.5 cup boiling water
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 8 marshmallows, finely cut
- 1 9-oz can crushed pineapple
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Chill milk in an ice tray until frozen around edges.
Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water, then stir in cold water.
Add marshmallows, pineapple, and nuts.
Whip milk until stiff and fold into Jell-O mixture.
Cover and chill for about 1 hour, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN KENTUCKY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.25 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 egg yolk
- 0.33 cup lemon juice
- 0.33 cup pineapple juice
- 1 cup pineapple chunks
- 1 cup white cherries
- 0.75 cup blanched almonds or pecans
- 0.75 cup whipping cream
- Mayonnaise, optional
<|steps|>
Heat lemon and pineapple juice in a double boiler.
Blend sugar, flour, and salt with egg yolk, then add to heated juices.
Cook to the consistency of boiled dressing, then cool.
Whip cream and fold in the cooled mixture, then add coarsely chopped fruit and nuts.
Pour into a refrigerator tray and freeze for about 3 hours.
Serve on lettuce with or without mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. cooked, chopped prunes
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in prunes and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint strawberries
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 cups whipping cream
- 2 tsp lemon juice
- 2 egg whites
- Whipped cream, optional
<|steps|>
Wash and stem strawberries, add sugar, and crush.
Heat until sugar dissolves, then strain and chill.
Add lemon juice to berry mixture.
Fold in whipped cream and stiffly beaten egg whites with salt.
Pour into a freezing tray, mold, or individual cups.
Freeze without stirring.
Serve plain or with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUNGRY BOY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Casserole:**
- 1 pound ground meat
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup green peppers
- 1 clove minced garlic
- 11/4 cups water
- ¾ cup tomato paste (6 oz can)
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon Accent
- 1 pound can pork and beans
- 1 can lima beans, drained
- **Biscuits:**
- 11/2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- Milk (enough to make 1/2 cup with egg)
- 1 tablespoon salad oil
