- 1/2 cup sliced stuffed olives
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1 cup reserved meat mixture
<|steps|>
**Casserole:** Sauté ground meat, celery, onion, green peppers, and garlic in a large skillet; drain.
Add water, tomato paste, salt, paprika, and Accent; simmer for 5 minutes.
Reserve 1 cup of meat mixture for biscuits.
Add pork and beans and lima beans to the remaining meat mixture, then transfer to an 8 x 13-inch or 2-quart baking dish.
**Biscuits:** Sift flour, baking powder, and salt; cut in shortening.
Combine egg with enough milk to make ½ cup, add to flour mixture, and stir until dough clings together.
Knead dough lightly about 12 times, then roll into a triangle.
Brush with salad oil, combine reserved meat, olives, almonds, and paprika, and spread on dough.
Roll dough as for a jelly roll, slice into 1-inch biscuits, and place on top of casserole.
Dot biscuits with butter and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 425°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACKBERRY JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 cup. sifted flour
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 2 cup. blackberry jam
- 1 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 1 tsp. cloves
- 6 eggs
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Dissolve soda in buttermilk.
Sift spices and flour together.
Add alternately with milk.
Fold in jam last.
Bake in 3 layers 9" pans greased and floured in 350 degree oven 30 or 40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK GINGERBREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. molasses
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and shortening, add egg and molasses.
Mix dry ingredients, add alternately with hot water to creamed mixture.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.33 cup butter
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 medium green pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 medium onions, sliced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes
- 1 pkg frozen cut okra
- 3 beef bouillon cubes
- 4 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 0.25 tsp ground cloves
- 0.5 tsp chili powder
- 2 bay leaves
- 1.5 tbsp salt
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 3 cups water
- 2 lbs shelled raw shrimp
- 3 cups hot cooked rice
- 0.75 cup snipped parsley
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a Dutch oven, stir in flour, and cook over low heat until brown.
Add green pepper, onions, and garlic; cook slowly until tender.
Add tomatoes, bouillon cubes, Worcestershire sauce, cloves, chili powder, bay leaves, salt, pepper, and water.
Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes.
Add okra and simmer for 30 minutes.
Heat to boiling, add shrimp, and simmer covered until shrimp are pink and tender.
Remove bay leaves.
Toss rice with parsley, form a ring on shallow plates, and fill center with gumbo for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WALDORF ASTORIA RED CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 1.25 cups white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 2 oz red food coloring
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp vinegar
- 2 tsp cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup butter
- 3 tbsp flour
<|steps|>
Mix vinegar and baking soda in a small cup and let stand.
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Make a paste of cocoa and some red food coloring; add to creamed mixture.
Add remaining coloring, then alternate buttermilk, salt, and flour.
Add vanilla, then soda and vinegar mixture; stir well.
Pour into two 8-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cool and split layers in half lengthwise.
For frosting, cook 3 tbsp flour and milk until thick, then cool.
Cream 1 cup sugar and butter until fluffy, gradually add flour-milk mixture, beating constantly.
Spread frosting between layers and on top, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **REFRIGERATOR ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3/4 cup. water, warm
- 1/2 cup. gran. sugar
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 6 cup. sifted all purpose flour
- 2 pkgs. active dry yeast
- 1 tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 cup. soft butter or marg.
- 1 tbsp. butter, melted
<|steps|>
Pour warm water into a large bowl.
Sprinkle the yeast over the water; add sugar and salt; stir to dissolve completely.
Add eggs, soft butter and 3 cups flour.
With wooden spoon or electric mixer at medium speed, beat very hard 2 minutes or until smooth.
Gradually add 1 cup flour, beating hard after each addition.
Using hands, work remaining 2 cups flour into dough, with hands, until smooth and elastic.
Brush tip of the dough with melted butter; cover with a double thickness of saran or with a damp towel.
Let the dough rise in refrigerator at least 2 hours, or until it is double in bulk.
Punch down dough, and refrigerate.
Store in refrigerator 1 to 3 days punching it down once a day.
Shape and bake at 400 to 425 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PUMPKIN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. pumpkin puree
- 3/4 cup. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix pumpkin, sugar, salt, spices, eggs, and milk.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED HAM FINGER ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Thinly sliced bread
- Softened horseradish butter
- Paper-thin baked ham slices
<|steps|>
Slice bread very thin and spread with softened horseradish butter.
Place a slice of paper-thin baked ham on each bread slice.
Roll up the bread slices.
Toast under a broiler, turning to brown evenly on all sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SARAH TURNER'S SAN ANTONIO GUACAMOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 2 tablespoons cream
- 1/2 triangle Roquefort cheese
- 1 avocado
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 3 tiny scallions, minced
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- Mayonnaise, as needed
<|steps|>
Soften cream cheese with cream, then mash Roquefort cheese.
Combine both cheeses with mayonnaise and blend until smooth.
Peel and mash avocado, then add garlic, scallions, Tabasco, Worcestershire, salt, and pepper.
Blend well, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
Stir before serving, as the top may darken. Serves 6-8.
Serve with potato chips.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NANNIE'S CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans English peas
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped
- 1/2 pound New York cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 slices bread
- 1 egg
- Milk, as needed
<|steps|>
Soak bread in milk, then drain off excess milk.
Mix peas, tomatoes, onion, green pepper, cheese, egg, soaked bread, salt, and pepper.
Pour into a buttered casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEA CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Roll out, cut into rounds, bake at 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MUSHROOM RICE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup rice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 can creamed mushroom soup
- 1 small can mushroom stems and pieces
- Broken pecans or almonds
- 1/2 cup butter
- 12 oranges
- 1 can pineapple chunks
- 1 fresh coconut, grated
- 1 fresh grapefruit
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Sugar, to taste
- Red cherries or strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil rice, rinse, and season with nutmeg.
In a well-greased casserole, layer rice, mushroom soup, broken nuts, and mushrooms.
Repeat layers, ending with nuts on top.
Melt butter and pour over the casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until heated through.
Optionally, prepare the day before and add melted butter just before baking.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel and cut oranges into chunks.
Add pineapple chunks (with juice), grapefruit segments, lemon juice, and grated coconut.
Sweeten to taste.
Refrigerate overnight to season thoroughly.
Garnish with red cherries or strawberries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box white cake mix
- 1 cup. cooking oil
- 4 eggs
- 1 box strawberry Jello
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 box frozen strawberries
- **Icing:**
- 1/2 box frozen strawberries
- 1 box conf. sugar
- 1 stick butter
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine all ingredients and beat for 10 minutes.
Put into 3 greased pans.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes.
For icing, have butter and frozen strawberries at room temperature.
Mix with confectioners sugar and spread on strawberry cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. blackberry jam
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in jam and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LYE HOMINY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart shelled corn
- 2 tsp concentrated lye
- Water, as needed
- 1 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Place corn in a vessel that holds 2 gallons, fill nearly full with water mixed with lye, and bring to a boil.
Cook for 30 minutes, then remove from heat and rinse with cold water until free of lye.
Refill pan with water, add salt, and bring to a boil.
Place in a deep-well cooker or low heat and cook for about 4 hours until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Wash, pare, and cut eggplant into pieces.
Boil eggplant, onion, salt, and pepper in water to cover until tender.
Drain in a colander, then mix with beaten egg.
Drop mixture by spoonfuls into a hot greased skillet and fry like hotcakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tall cans pork and beans
- 1/2 cup. syrup
- 1 cup. chopped onions
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tbsp. mustard
- 1 cup. catsup
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1/2 stick marg.
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
<|steps|>
Cook onions and celery in butter till tender (not brown).
Add all other ingredients and bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours in a slow oven, 300 degrees.
Place several strips of bacon across top of beans the last hour of baking.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- ¾ cup margarine
- 1 (6 oz) can evaporated milk
- 1 (12 oz) package semi-sweet chocolate bits
- 1 (7 oz) jar marshmallow creme
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, margarine, and evaporated milk in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Cook, stirring, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage or 238°F.
Remove from heat and stir in chocolate bits.
Add marshmallow creme, vanilla, and nuts; beat until well blended.
Pour into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan and cool.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN LEMON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tall can evap. milk
- 1 cup. gran. sugar
- 2-3 lemons, juice only
- graham crackers
<|steps|>
Put milk into ice tray and let chill until a crust about 1/4" forms all over the pan.
Line bottom of refrigerator tray with graham crackers.
Whip milk until very thick (at least double in bulk).
Add sugar gradually, then lemon juice.
Pour into tray and cover with graham cracker crumbs.
Freeze and slice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PAN BROILED PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 slice ham (1 inch thick)
- 1/2 cup. orange juice
- 1/4 cup. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. dry mustard
<|steps|>
Season chops with salt and pepper.
Heat skillet, brown chops on both sides.
Add water, cover, simmer 30-40 minutes until tender.
**HAM WITH ORANGE SAUCE**
Bake ham at 325°F for 30 minutes.
Mix orange juice, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, and mustard in saucepan, cook until thickened.
Pour sauce over ham, bake 10 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEEP DISH APPLE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cup. sliced apples
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Place in deep baking dish, dot with butter.
Cover with pie crust, slit top.
Bake at 375°F for 45-50 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- 7 tbsp cocoa
- 3 tbsp white corn syrup
- 1.5 cups sweet milk
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Butter, size of an egg
- 1 cup nuts
<|steps|>
Stir sugar, cocoa, corn syrup, and milk well, then cook until a small amount hardens in a saucer.
Remove from heat, add vanilla and butter.
Beat until the mixture thickens, then add nuts.
Pour onto a greased platter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAMED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 pounds small white onions
- 1/2 cup ground almonds
- 31/2 tablespoons butter
- 11/2 tablespoons flour
- 11/2 cups milk
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 3 tablespoons fine bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash and peel onions, then boil for about 5 minutes or until just tender; drain well and place in a greased baking dish.
Melt 1½ tablespoons butter, blend in flour, and slowly stir in milk; cook until slightly thickened.
Add ground almonds, salt, pepper, and nutmeg to the sauce.
Pour sauce over onions.
Mix bread crumbs with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter and sprinkle over the top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.25 cup butter
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 cup milk
- 1.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp baking soda
- Pinch of salt
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 cup stewed, chopped prunes
- 1 cup pure maple syrup
- 2 egg whites
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 0.75 cup shortening
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 0.5 package seedless raisins
- 2 cups pecans
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tbsp boiling water
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and butter, then add eggs one at a time and milk.
Sift flour with baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into mixture.
Add prunes and mix.
Bake in a loaf pan at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
Boil maple syrup until it spins a thread, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat until thick.
Ice the cake with maple icing.
**ROCKS**
Cream shortening and sugar, then add beaten eggs.
Dredge dates, raisins, and pecans in flour, then add to mixture.
Dissolve baking soda in boiling water and add.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake in a moderate oven for about 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TAMALE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 bag (6 oz) Fritos, crushed
- 2 cans (151/2 oz) chili con carne
- 1/2 cup American cheese, grated
- 1 medium onion, chopped
<|steps|>
Line a 1½-quart casserole with a layer of crushed Fritos.
Add a layer of one can of chili con carne, then another layer of Fritos.
Add a layer of chopped onion, followed by another layer of Fritos.
Add a layer of the second can of chili con carne, then top with a final layer of Fritos.
Bake at 450°F for 30 minutes.
Immediately top with grated cheese to melt.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/8 cup. shortening
- 2 cup. flour (more or less as needed)
- 1/2 or 3 lb. chicken
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 qt. water (for boiling)
<|steps|>
Mix together buttermilk, soda, salt, and shortening.
Add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Work it until quite firm.
Roll out about 2/3 of dough very thin. Cut into small pieces for dumplings.
Cut the chicken in pieces and boil in about 1 qt. of water until tender. Salt to suit taste.
Place the chicken and broth in 10 inch pan or casserole.
Drop in dumplings. Sprinkle in pepper and dot with butter.
Roll out remainder of dough large as pan and place on top.
Bake until brown, brush with butter and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE CREAM PUNCH FOR 50**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 gal. sherbet
- 6 bottles gingerale
- 4 cups pineapple juice
- 1 gal. vanilla ice cream
- 2 small cans orange juice
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Serve chilled.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED PEPPERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 green peppers
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. cooked rice
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. tomato sauce
<|steps|>
Cut tops off peppers, remove seeds and membranes.
Mix beef, onion, rice, salt, and pepper, stuff peppers.
Place in baking dish, pour tomato sauce over and around peppers.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON CROQUETTES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. fat
<|steps|>
Mix salmon, bread crumbs, egg, onion, salt, pepper, and milk.
Shape into patties.
Fry in hot fat until browned on both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WINE JELLY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package gelatine
- 0.5 pint cold water
- 1 lb sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- Grated rind of 1 lemon
- 0.5 tsp cinnamon
- 1 pint water
- 0.5 pint wine
- 1 fresh cocoanut
- 1 dozen oranges
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water.
Combine sugar, lemon juice, lemon rind, cinnamon, and 1 pint water; bring to a boil.
Add gelatine and water, stirring until dissolved.
Strain and cool, then add wine.
Pour into wet molds and chill to congeal.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel oranges and skin the sections.
Grate cocoanut.
Mix oranges and cocoanut, sweeten to taste.
Let stand for several hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 heaping tbsp lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
- 2.25 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 6 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients and work in lard.
Add buttermilk to make a soft dough.
Knead well, roll out to 0.5 inch thickness.
Bake in a 450°F oven until golden brown.
**WAFFLES**
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add buttermilk to make a thin batter, then add egg and beat well.
Add melted lard.
Bake in a waffle iron.
Serve with melted butter and sorghum.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEPPER RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 red peppers
- 12 green peppers
- 12 onions
- 2 cups vinegar
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 2 tablespoons salt
<|steps|>
Coarsely cut or grind peppers and onions.
Cover with boiling water and let stand for 5 minutes; drain.
Cover again with boiling water and let stand for 10 minutes; drain.
Combine vinegar, sugar, and salt; boil for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables and boil together for 10 minutes.
Can the relish in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLAZED BAKED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 whole ham
- Whole cloves (optional)
- Brown sugar, for glaze
- Pineapple juice, for glaze
- Water, for glaze
<|steps|>
Place ham in a roaster with 1/2 inch water and bake at 325°F for 20 minutes per pound.
Remove from oven, peel off the skin, and score the fat.
Mix brown sugar with pineapple juice to form a thick paste and spread over the ham.
Insert whole cloves if desired.
Return to the oven and baste until golden brown.
During the last 10 minutes, increase heat to 450°F to form a crust.
Let cool in its own juices. Serve hot or cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRISP CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound grated mild cheese
- 1/2 pound butter or oleo
- 1/2 cup flour
- Pecan halves
<|steps|>
Mix cheese, butter, and flour, then roll out to desired thinness.
Cut into small rings with a cutter.
Fold each ring over a pecan half and place in the center.
Bake at 400°F for 10-15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 sm. onion, chopped
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. Accent
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 can green beans
- 2 cup. mashed potatoes
<|steps|>
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook onion in fat 2 tablespoons of hot fat until yellow.
Add meat and cook until brown.
Add seasonings, drained beans and soup.
Pour into 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
Spoon mashed potatoes over top of mixture.
Bake 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. Karo syrup
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup. butter, melted
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix syrup, sugar, eggs, and butter, stir in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN SOUFFLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pt. canned corn
- 2 eggs, beaten lightly
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. mustard
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1/2 stick butter or oleo
- 1 Tbsp. chopped olives
- 1 Tbsp. chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook butter and onions in skillet until onions are clear or light brown, remove from heat.
Add corn, eggs, milk, mustard, salt, pepper, olives, and pimiento.
Cook in moderate oven until set and slightly browned on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWISS STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. round steak
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Pound flour, salt, and pepper into steak.
Brown steak in fat, add onion, tomatoes, and water.
Cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAVORY MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK BOTTOM PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 16 ginger snaps
- 0.25 cup butter or margarine
- 1 tbsp unflavored gelatin
- 0.25 cup cold water
- 1.75 cups milk
- 1 tbsp cornstarch
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp rum flavoring
- 4 eggs, separated
- 2 squares unsweetened chocolate
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 0.125 tsp almond extract
- 0.125 tsp cream of tartar
- Shaved chocolate, for garnish
<|steps|>
Roll ginger snaps into fine crumbs and mix with softened margarine.
Press into a 10-inch pie pan and bake at 300°F for 10 minutes.
Soak gelatin in cold water.
Scald milk, then mix cornstarch, 0.5 cup sugar, and salt.
Beat egg yolks, stir in sugar-cornstarch mixture, then add warm milk.
Cook over hot water until mixture coats a spoon, then add gelatin.
Divide custard: to one half, add melted chocolate, vanilla, and almond extract; pour into crust.
Cool the other half, then beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff, adding 0.5 cup sugar.
Fold cooled custard and rum flavoring into egg whites, spread over chocolate layer.
Sprinkle with shaved chocolate and chill for several hours, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLE SLAW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- Cabbage (quantity not specified)
- 1 small carrot
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 1/3 cup. vinegar
- 3 tsp. sugar
- Canned cream
<|steps|>
Chop cabbage fine, add grated small carrot.
Mix mayonnaise and vinegar until blended, add sugar.
Add cream until creamy and thick.
Combine with cabbage and carrot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4.25 cups sugar
- 1 large can evaporated milk
- 3 pkgs semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 8 oz jar marshmallow cream
- 0.5 lb margarine
- 2 tsp vanilla
- Pinch salt
- Nuts, optional
<|steps|>
Mix salt, sugar, margarine, and milk; boil for 9-10 minutes, stirring.
Remove from heat and add chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, vanilla, and nuts.
Pour into a greased dish and cut when cool, for about 5 lbs of fudge.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUR CREAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cup. sugar
- 2 sticks soft butter
- 6 eggs, beat in 1 at a time
- 2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 3 cup. flour with 1/4 tsp. soda sifted in it
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, then flour a little at a time with cream.
Bake 1 1/2 hours in big tube pan at 325 degrees or until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ONE-TWO-THREE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (12 oz) cocktail vegetable juice
- 1 package (3 oz) lemon-flavored gelatin
- 1 can (121/2 oz) condensed vegetable soup
<|steps|>
Lightly oil six (½-cup) molds with salad oil and set aside.
Heat vegetable juice until very hot, pour over gelatin in a bowl, and stir until completely dissolved.
Blend in vegetable soup.
Pour into molds and chill until set.
Unmold onto crisp lettuce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE MOLD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated Old English cheese
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 eggs
- Creamed asparagus, for garnish
- Mushrooms, for garnish
- Tiny peas, for garnish
- Onions, for garnish
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a saucepan over boiling water and gradually add flour.
Add milk and cook until the mixture thickens, stirring constantly.
Add grated cheese and salt, stirring until melted, then remove from heat.
Gradually stir in well-beaten eggs.
Pour into a greased flat-bottomed pan and bake in a slow oven until golden brown and firm.
Unmold onto a platter, cover with creamed asparagus and mushrooms, and border with tiny peas and onions.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: - Shrimp
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 heaping tsp sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- Juice of 0.5 large lemon
- 1 tsp prepared mustard
- 1 pint salad oil
<|steps|>
Clean shrimp and place on a bed of crisp lettuce.
Mix olive oil with salt and white pepper in a bowl.
Blend mustard with oil a few drops at a time, adding a few drops of vinegar to prevent curdling.
When well blended, add paprika, parsley, celery, and onion.
Pour sauce over shrimp and lettuce.
**MAYONNAISE**
Beat egg in a mixer or bowl.
Add sugar, salt, lemon juice, and mustard.
While beating, add salad oil a little at a time.
Beat to desired thickness.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE NUT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (61/2 oz) package pitted dates
- 2 tablespoons shortening
- 11/2 cups boiling water
- 1 egg, beaten
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract
<|steps|>
Cut dates into quarters, add shortening, and pour boiling water over; cool.
Add egg and sugar to the date mixture and mix.
Sift flour, salt, and baking soda together; combine with nuts and lemon extract.
Add dry ingredients to the date mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup. cooked noodles
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef with onion and celery in skillet.
Add soup, noodles, salt, and pepper, mix well.
Pour into greased casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME JELLO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box lime Jell-O
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. celery, cut fine
- 1 pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1/2 cup. nuts, chopped fine
<|steps|>
Pour hot water over Jell-O, stir until dissolved, add pineapple.
Let stand until it begins to set, add celery, cheese, and nuts.
Whip cream stiff, fold in last, let set again.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups fresh corn, boiled and cut from cob, or 1 No. 2 can small kernel white corn
- 1.25 tbsp sugar
- 1 tbsp flour
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 0.75 cup milk
- 0.33 stick butter
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and flour, then add corn, salt, beaten eggs, milk, and melted butter.
Pour into a buttered baking dish.
Bake at 300°F, stirring from edges to center until pudding begins to firm.
Continue baking until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAR-B-Q-CHICKEN IN THE BAG**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Place in oven bag, pour barbecue sauce over chicken.
Seal bag, make a few slits, bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BOILED COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 0.5 stick butter or margarine
- 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
- 2.5 cups one-minute oatmeal
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 0.5 cup milk
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and cocoa, then add milk and butter.
Boil exactly 1 minute.
Add peanut butter, oatmeal, and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper, for about 24 cookies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in baking dish, pour barbecue sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PONE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 cups boiling water
<|steps|>
Mix corn meal, salt, and boiling water thoroughly.
Shape into oval cakes, about 0.5 inch thick.
Place on a greased pan and bake in a quick oven or on top of the stove, turning to brown both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. lemon extract
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice (for glaze)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk, lemon juice, and lemon extract.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For glaze, mix sugar and lemon juice, pour over warm cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 egg whites, beaten stiff
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Fold in egg whites.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 2 tablespoons Knox gelatin
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup rum
<|steps|>
Soak gelatin in 1/2 cup cool water in the top of a double boiler, then dissolve over hot water.
Beat egg yolks until very light, then slowly beat in sugar using an electric beater.
Slowly add melted hot gelatin to the egg yolk mixture, then add rum drop by drop while beating.
Set aside to cool and begin setting.
Beat egg whites until very stiff and dry.
When the rum mixture begins to congeal, fold in the egg whites and whipped cream.
Pour into a mold and refrigerate until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. water or 1 7-Up + 2 oz.
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 tbsp. Karo syrup
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 3-oz. pkg. strawberry Jello
- 1 to 1 1/2 pt. fresh strawberries
<|steps|>
Mix and boil above ingredients, except Jello and strawberries, until thick and completely clear, about 4 minutes.
Remove and add Jello, stir until dissolved.
Cook pie pastry and while hot, sprinkle 3 tablespoons of sugar over shell.
Let cool.
Wash and drain berries, place in pastry whole.
Pour syrup mixture over berries.
Let cool.
Whipped cream is used as topping and may be put on pie when served in individual pieces or on whole pie before cut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ICEBOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 1/2 cup. lemon juice
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 graham cracker crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix condensed milk, lemon juice, and egg yolks.
Pour into crust, chill until set.
Top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN BANANA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup lemon juice
- 4 bananas, mashed
- 1 pint heavy cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Mix pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan and cook until sugar dissolves.
Cool slightly, then stir in mashed bananas.
Fold in whipped cream and chopped nuts.
Pour into a mold or ice tray and freeze until firm.
Unmold onto lettuce leaves to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEATEN BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups flour
- 1 tbsp lard
- 1 tsp salt
- Cold water, as needed
<|steps|>
Mix flour, lard, and salt, adding enough cold water to make a stiff dough.
Place on a marble slab and beat with a bat or rolling pin until dough begins to blister, at least 500 strokes.
Roll out about 0.5 inch thick, cut with a small biscuit cutter, and prick the top of each biscuit with a fork.
Bake in a slow oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEAR RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 quarts ground pears
- 2 quarts ground white onions
- 8 green bell peppers
- 4 red bell peppers
- 2 hot peppers
- 12 large dill pickles
- 4 cups sugar
- 2 quarts vinegar
- 4 tablespoons salt
- 6 tablespoons turmeric
- 8 tablespoons mustard (dry or prepared)
- 2 tablespoons flour
<|steps|>
Sprinkle salt over ground pears and let stand for 5 minutes; drain.
Grind onions, bell peppers, hot peppers, and dill pickles, then mix with drained pears.
Add vinegar and bring to a boil for 5 minutes.
Add flour, sugar, mustard, and turmeric; cook until flour is well done.
Can the relish in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small garlic clove, crushed
- 0.75 cup mayonnaise
- Juice of 1-2 lemons
- 0.25 cup ketchup
- Paprika, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 No. 2 can sauerkraut
- 2 medium apples, sliced, unpeeled
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
<|steps|>
Mix garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, ketchup, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Optionally add blue or Roquefort cheese.
Prepare the day before for best flavor, for 6-8 servings.
**RELISH**
Add apples and brown sugar to sauerkraut.
Simmer until apples disintegrate, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 1 large can fruit cocktail
- 18 marshmallows
- Few drops onion juice
- 1 pint heavy cream
- 2 packages Philadelphia cream cheese
- Red jelly roll, thinly sliced, for mold lining
- Whipped cream, for garnish
<|steps|>
Line a ring mold with thin slices of red jelly roll, forming a uniform pattern.
Melt marshmallows in the juice from the fruit cocktail.
Mix in cream cheese and whipped heavy cream.
Add mayonnaise and onion juice, ensuring not to overpower the flavor.
Spoon the mixture into the lined mold (it should be too stiff to pour) and smooth the top.
Freeze until set.
Unmold onto a serving tray, fill the center with whipped cream, and decorate the base with additional whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE FLOAT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart cooked apples
- Nutmeg, to taste
- Sugar, to taste
- 4 egg whites
- 1 pint boiled custard, optional
<|steps|>
Mash cooked apples through a sieve, sweeten, and flavor with nutmeg.
Mix with beaten egg whites.
Serve plain or pour over boiled custard.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER-NUT SNOWBALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups finely chopped pecans
- Powdered sugar, for coating
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and vanilla until fluffy.
Sift flour with salt and add to the butter mixture, blending thoroughly.
Add pecans and mix well.
Shape into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 325°F for about 20 minutes; do not brown.
Cool, then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter, mix with powdered sugar and cocoa.
Add milk and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAWAIIAN SUPPER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups cooked ham, in julienne strips
- 1 9-oz can pineapple tidbits
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
- 1.5 tbsp cornstarch
- 1 tsp monosodium glutamate
- 3 tsp vinegar
- 2 tsp prepared mustard
- 0.75 cup water
- 1 green pepper, cut in strips
- Hot cooked rice
<|steps|>
Brown ham in a small amount of hot fat.
Drain pineapple, reserving syrup.
Mix brown sugar, cornstarch, monosodium glutamate, vinegar, and mustard; stir in pineapple syrup and water.
Add mixture to ham, cook and stir until thickened.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add pineapple and green pepper, simmer for 7 minutes.
Serve on rice for 4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUSH PUPPIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- Fat (for frying)
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, add onion.
Combine egg and milk, add to dry ingredients.
Drop by spoonfuls into hot fat, fry until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. white Karo
- 1 cup. grated coconut
<|steps|>
Combine sugar and flour.
Beat eggs and add sugar and flour mixture and salt.
Add Karo, then vanilla.
Add coconut and pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Meringue (2 egg whites, 1/4 cup. sugar)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cocoa, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with meringue, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED CABBAGE AND APPLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tart apples, sliced
- 4 slices bacon
- 2 small red cabbages, shredded
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1/2 cup vinegar
- 6 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 teaspoons salt
- Dash of red pepper
- 2 small onions, thinly sliced
<|steps|>
Fry bacon until crisp.
Add apples, cabbage, boiling water, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, red pepper, and onions to the bacon.
Simmer until cabbage is tender.
Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CONGEALED VEGETABLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 2 cups boiling water
- 0.25 cup sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup cabbage, finely shredded
- 1 large cucumber, chopped
- 1 bunch celery, chopped
- 1 large green pepper, chopped
- 1 large sweet red pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp finely chopped onion
- Several small radishes, sliced
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes.
Add vinegar, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and boiling water.
When mixture begins to congeal, add chopped vegetables.
Chill and serve on lettuce or watercress, garnished with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 cup cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla or 1 tablespoon brandy
- Nutmeg, to taste
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- Grated rind of 1 lemon
- Pinch of salt
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 egg, separated
- 2 tablespoons sherry or brandy
- 1/4 cup heavy cream, whipped
- 2 cups milk
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Combine brown sugar, butter, and cream in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and beat until thick.
Spread over cake while still warm.
**HARD SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla or brandy and a pinch of nutmeg.
Chill until firm and serve with pudding or pie.
**LEMON SAUCE**
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan.
Gradually stir in boiling water and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in butter, lemon juice, and lemon rind.
Serve warm over puddings or cakes.
**FOAMY SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light.
Add egg yolk and sherry or brandy, beating well.
Beat egg white until stiff and fold into the mixture.
Fold in whipped cream just before serving.
Serve warm over desserts.
**CUSTARD SAUCE**
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Beat egg yolks with sugar and salt, then gradually stir in hot milk.
Return to the double boiler and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and cool.
Serve chilled over desserts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. lemon zest
- 1-2 Tbsp. milk
<|steps|>
Cream butter and powdered sugar.
Add lemon juice, zest, and milk, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERSCOTCH COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 egg or 2 egg yolks
- 1 tablespoon cream
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 11/2 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar in a saucepan.
Stir in egg, cream, vanilla, flour, baking powder, and walnuts in the order listed.
Pour onto a buttered cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes until a light touch with a finger leaves a very slight imprint.
Note: Cookies become chewier and tastier when stored.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRACKLIN' BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups white corn meal
- Hot water, as needed
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp lard
- 2 cups finely chopped or ground cracklings
<|steps|>
Mix corn meal with hot water to make a soft dough.
Add salt, lard, and cracklings.
Mold into flat, oval cakes with hands.
Place on a greased baking sheet and bake in a hot oven until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEA FOAM CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 egg whites
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. corn syrup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. corn syrup
- 1 cup. cream
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/3 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, water, and corn syrup to hard ball stage (250°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff, slowly pour in hot syrup, beating constantly.
Add vanilla and nuts, beat until mixture holds shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**TAFFY**
Cook sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt to hard ball stage (250°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla and butter, pour onto greased slab.
Cool until manageable, pull until white and porous, cut into pieces.
**CARAMELS**
Cook sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, and cream to firm ball stage (245°F).
Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla, pour into greased pan.
Cool, cut into squares, wrap in waxed paper.
**BROWNIES**
Melt butter, mix with sugar, eggs, and cocoa.
Add flour, salt, vanilla, and nuts, stir until blended.
Pour into greased 8x8 pan, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HITCHING POST SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 1 cup catsup
- 1 cup grated hard-boiled eggs (3 eggs)
- 1 cup chopped parsley
- 1 cup small pickled white onions
- 1 cup broken pecan meats
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup chili sauce
- 1 teaspoon A.1. sauce
- 1/2 clove garlic, finely cut
- 1 teaspoon anchovy paste
- 1 bottle capers, drained
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 3 dashes hot sauce
- 2 garlic cloves, chopped
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup tomato catsup
- 1 teaspoon prepared mustard
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 2 tablespoons cold water
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 onion, grated
- 1 tablespoon horseradish
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients and let stand for 24 hours.
Serve on grapefruit or head lettuce.
**ROSE'S PICKWICK SHRIMP SAUCE**
Drain capers and finely cut garlic.
Mix all ingredients together and chill.
**ROY ROY'S SAUCE**
Combine all ingredients in a quart jar.
Shake well to mix thoroughly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX FRUIT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 lbs. raisins
- 1 lb. marshmallows
- 1 lb. crushed graham crackers
- 1 lg. bottle cherries, drained
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 pts. nuts
- 1 box coconut
- 1 box conf. sugar
- 6 eggs
- 3 sticks marg. or butter
- 1 box flour, measured in sugar box
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Dissolve marshmallows in the milk.
Add other ingredients, mixing well (crystallized fruits and citron, chopped fine, may be added if desired).
Press firmly into a mold and let stand 6 hours.
Use as desired.
**CONFECTIONERS POUND CAKE**
Have butter at room temperature.
Blend sugar and butter together until smooth.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Blend small portions of the cake flour with each egg.
Beat well after each mixture.
Continue adding eggs and flour together until all are blended well.
Place in a round tube pan for 1 hour at 300 degrees.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOMINY AND ALMOND CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 10.5-oz can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 0.5 cup coffee cream
- 0.25 tsp cayenne
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp celery seed
- 0.5 tsp freshly ground pepper
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 No. 2.5 can hominy
- 0.5 lb almonds, toasted and halved
- 1 cup buttered crumbs
<|steps|>
Mix soup, cream, cayenne, Worcestershire sauce, celery seed, pepper, and salt; simmer until blended.
Drain hominy and place in a buttered casserole.
Add almonds to soup mixture and pour over hominy.
Cover with buttered crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30-40 minutes, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRATED SWEET POTATO PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/4 cups grated or ground sweet potato
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ginger
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 2 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a buttered baking dish and bake uncovered at 350°F for 45 minutes.
When the top browns, turn under and let brown again to give a grainy texture.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT TEA PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 cups brisk tea
- 1 cup frozen lemonade
- 3/4 cup mint syrup
- **Mint Syrup:**
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup water
- Mint 30 leaves
<|steps|>
Bruise mint leaves in sugar.
Add water and stir over heat until sugar dissolves.
Simmer 3 to 5 minutes.
Strain out leaves, store in refrigerator.
Combine tea, lemonade, and mint syrup.
Serve chilled.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED CHEESE FINGERS**
<|ingredients|>
- Small jar pimento olives, finely chopped
- Thinly sliced bread
- Cream, as needed
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- Roka cheese, to taste
<|steps|>
Work cream cheese with a little cream to a smooth paste.
Add Roka cheese to taste and finely chopped olives.
Spread on bread slices, roll, and toast under a broiler.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 (8 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 cup cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup maraschino cherries, chopped
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 small can fruit cocktail, drained
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then set in a pan of boiling water to dissolve.
Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar; add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, nuts, cherries, pineapple, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a tray and refrigerate until firm, several hours or overnight.
Slice and serve on a lettuce leaf with a dab of mayonnaise and a cherry on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 cups milk
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, separated
- 1 tbsp butter
- 1 cup moist cocoanut, grated
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Mix flour, sugar, and egg yolks, then add to milk.
Cook until thick, remove from heat, and add butter, cocoanut, and vanilla.
Pour into a baked pie shell.
Top with meringue made from egg whites, optionally sprinkling with reserved cocoanut.
Brown meringue in a slow oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICH PASTRY PIE CRUST**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/3 cup. shortening
- 2-3 Tbsp. cold water
<|steps|>
Mix flour and salt, cut in shortening.
Add water, mix until dough forms.
Roll out to fit pie pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRUNCH CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter, melted
- 1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup milk
<|steps|>
Melt 2 tablespoons butter and pour into the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Mix walnuts, brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, and cinnamon; sprinkle 1/3 of this mixture over the bottom of the pan.
Cream ¼ cup butter and sugar, then add eggs one at a time, blending well.
Sift together 2 cups flour, baking powder, and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with milk.
Pour half the batter into the pan and spread carefully over the bottom.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the nut mixture over the batter, then pour in remaining batter.
Sprinkle remaining nut mixture on top.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can green asparagus
- 4 hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 heaping tbsp flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup asparagus liquor
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 0.25 cup butter
- 1 cup cracker crumbs
- Paprika, for sprinkling
<|steps|>
Melt 2 tbsp butter in a double boiler, add flour, then milk and asparagus liquor; cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
In another pan, melt 0.25 cup butter and mix with cracker crumbs.
Butter a baking dish, sprinkle half the buttered crumbs on the bottom.
Layer asparagus, sliced eggs, and half the white sauce.
Add remaining asparagus, eggs, and white sauce.
Top with remaining buttered crumbs and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOUSSES PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup sorghum molasses
- 2 tbsp vinegar
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 1 cup pecans, optional
- Unbaked pastry, for pie pan
<|steps|>
Mix cornstarch with sugar, then add beaten eggs, molasses, vinegar, melted butter, and salt.
Add pecans if desired.
Pour into a large pie pan lined with unbaked pastry.
Bake slowly in a moderate oven until the custard mixture is set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **1-2-3-4 CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound soft butter (not melted)
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 large eggs
- 3¾ cups plain flour
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 small box honey graham cracker crumbs
- 1 stick melted butter
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 1 large package cream cheese
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 small package lemon jello
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 large can evaporated milk, chilled
<|steps|>
Ensure all ingredients are at room temperature (out of the refrigerator for at least 1 hour).
Cream butter and sugar well.
Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition.
Add milk and flour alternately, starting and ending with flour.
Sift baking powder with the last cup of flour.
Add vanilla to the last portion of milk.
Pour into a greased and floured tube pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
**CHEESECAKE**
Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and powdered sugar; line a large dish or pan with the mixture, reserving some crumbs for topping.
Cream sugar, cream cheese, and vanilla together.
Dissolve lemon jello in 1 cup hot water and let cool.
Whip chilled evaporated milk, then add cream cheese mixture and cooled jello.
Pour into the crumb-lined dish, sprinkle reserved crumbs on top, and chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GYPSY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 can corn, drained
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef, onion, and green pepper.
Add corn, tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups cake flour
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 egg
- Grated rind of 1 orange
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 1/4 cup undiluted evaporated milk
- 1 cup orange juice (for glaze)
- 1 tablespoon butter (for glaze)
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice (for glaze)
- Grated rind of 1 orange (for glaze)
- 3/4 box confectioners' sugar (for glaze)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add well-beaten egg, orange juice, evaporated milk, and grated orange rind.
Sift flour and baking powder together and add to the wet mixture.
Optionally, refrigerate the batter for several hours.
Pour into small greased muffin tins and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.
For the glaze, cook orange juice, butter, lemon juice, and orange rind in a double boiler until butter melts.
Add confectioners' sugar, spread on baked muffins, and return to the oven briefly to set the glaze.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET CRISP CUCUMBER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- Medium size cucumbers
- 2 tsp. alum
- 1 qt. water (for alum solution)
- 1 qt. sugar
- 1 qt. vinegar
- Spices (to taste)
- Ice water (equal parts ice and water)
- 1 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup. chili sauce
- 1/2 cup. catsup
- 1 tsp. Tabasco sauce
<|steps|>
Slice cucumbers 1/8 inch thick, soak overnight in alum water (2 tsp. alum to 1 qt. water).
Drain, cover with same alum solution, simmer 2 hours (do not boil).
Drain, place in ice water until cold.
Make syrup of sugar, vinegar, and spices, boil until thick.
Place cucumbers in syrup one jar at a time, bring to boil, replace in jar, let drain.
Repeat until all cucumbers are processed.
Boil syrup to thicken, pour over pickles, seal.
**SHRIMP SAUCE**
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- Dash of nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon chopped parsley
- 3 tablespoons chopped canned pimento
- 1 tablespoon chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon celery salt
- 6 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 1/2 cup butter
- 3 tablespoons enriched flour
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- Flour, for coating
- 1 slightly beaten egg mixed with 2 tablespoons water
- Cracker crumbs or crushed corn flakes, for coating
- Fat, for frying
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped mushroom stems
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Make a thick white sauce with butter, flour, milk, salt, paprika, nutmeg, and celery salt.
Add chopped eggs, parsley, pimento, and onion, mixing thoroughly.
Spread the mixture 1 inch thick in a greased shallow pan and chill thoroughly.
Shape into chop forms.
Dip each chop in flour, then in the egg-water mixture, and roll in cracker crumbs or crushed corn flakes.
Fry in shallow fat at 375°F for 5-7 minutes.
Drain on absorbent paper. Serves 6-8.
**MUSHROOM SAUCE**
Combine butter, milk, pepper, mushroom stems, flour, salt, and Worcestershire sauce in a saucepan.
Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened.
Serve with egg chops.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MUFFINS OR CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. melted shortening
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients.
Combine milk, egg, and shortening, add to dry ingredients, stir until just mixed.
Pour into greased muffin tins or baking pan.
Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Roll out, cut into shapes, bake at 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RAINBOW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 1 cup. Coca-Cola
- 1 finely chopped delicious apple
- Cottage cheese (firmly packed, dry)
- 1 pkg. orange Jell-O
- 2 cup. hot water
- 1 can crushed, drained pineapple
<|steps|>
Mix lime Jell-O with boiling water, dissolve, cool, add Coca-Cola.
When ready to congeal, add apple, let stand in refrigerator overnight.
Place 1-inch thick layer of cottage cheese over lime Jell-O.
Mix orange Jell-O with hot water, when ready to congeal, add pineapple, whip, pour over cottage cheese.
Let stand in refrigerator, slice, serve on lettuce with favorite dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar, boil 2 minutes.
Add milk, bring to boil, cool.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED TOAST**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup sweet milk
- Sliced bread, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Bacon drippings, for frying
<|steps|>
Beat egg and milk thoroughly, then season with salt to taste.
Dip bread slices one at a time in the mixture, coating lightly, and stack to await frying.
If needed, prepare additional egg and milk mixture to coat more slices.
Heat bacon drippings in an iron skillet or broiling pan, using just enough to brown one batch at a time.
Fry bread slices in hot fat until crisp and golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Cake:**
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 3 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 cup blackberry jam (preserves)
- **Filling:**
- 1 cup crushed pineapple
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
**Cake:** Cream butter, then gradually add sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour and baking soda together, then add alternately with buttermilk and jam.
Pour into three 9-inch layer pans and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
**Filling:** Mix pineapple, flour, and butter; cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
When cool, spread filling between layers and on top of the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients.
Combine milk and egg, add to dry ingredients, stir in nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound American cheese
- 1 (3 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 or more cloves garlic
- Pinch of salt
- Dash of Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Grate American cheese finely and mash or grate garlic finely.
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Roll into a long roll about the size of a half dollar and coat thoroughly with paprika.
Wrap in wax paper, then aluminum foil, and refrigerate for 2-3 days before use.
Slice and serve with crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VIRGINIA'S CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 jar Old English cheese
- 1 cup flour
- 1/4 cup butter
- Red pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Let cheese and butter come to room temperature, then mix well.
Shape into marble-sized balls.
Place on a cookie sheet 1-2 inches apart and chill for several hours.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes and serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NEVER FAIL FROSTING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 stick oleo
<|steps|>
Combine sugar and cocoa mix well.
Add milk and oleo.
Cook 5 minutes, remove from heat.
Cool and beat till of spreading consistency.
Double recipe for candy and add nuts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb yellow or white squash
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.5 cup bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash and trim squash, then cut into small pieces.
Boil squash and onion in water to cover until tender.
Add salt and pepper, then drain.
Melt butter in a skillet, add squash, and fry for several minutes.
Place mixture in a buttered casserole, cover with bread crumbs, and dot with butter.
Bake in a moderate oven for 20 minutes or until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED PIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cup. flour, plain
- 1/3 cup. buttermilk
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 2 tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- cooked fruit as filling
<|steps|>
Sift flour into a large mixing bowl.
Press down the center and add buttermilk, soda, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Work like biscuit with your hands.
Work till dough is real stiff.
Roll pretty thin and use any kind of cooked fruit as filling.
Use saucer to rounds of dough, place fruit on 1/2, fold other half over and press edges together.
Fry in hot shortening or bake on cookie sheet 350 degrees till brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE KISSES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 lb nuts (black walnuts preferred)
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites, gradually adding sugar until the mixture holds its shape.
Add nuts and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased brown paper.
Bake in a medium oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can Bing cherries
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 pkg. cream cheese
- 2 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 1 cup. pecans
- 2 warm Coca-Colas
<|steps|>
Combine cherry and pineapple juice, heat to boiling point, dissolve Jell-O in most of juice.
Use balance of juice to dissolve cheese, pour into Jell-O, cool.
Pit cherries, add pineapple, pecans, and Jell-O, slowly add Coca-Colas, chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (3 oz) packages cream cheese
- 1/2 cup salad dressing
- 3 tablespoons chili sauce
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion juice
- 4 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pound cooked shrimp or 1 (15 oz) can, well chopped
<|steps|>
Blend cream cheese with salad dressing, chili sauce, lemon juice, onion juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Add well-chopped shrimp and mix thoroughly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 small sweet potatoes
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup water
- ¾ cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup margarine, melted
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Wash, peel, and parboil sweet potatoes in salted water for about 15 minutes.
Place potatoes in a greased baking dish.
Combine brown sugar, margarine, ½ cup water, cinnamon, and sugar to make a syrup; pour over potatoes.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PUMPKIN PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. pumpkin puree
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. Karo syrup
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix pumpkin, sugar, spices, eggs, and milk.
Stir in syrup and pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 375°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWISS STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. round steak
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Pound flour, salt, and pepper into steak.
Brown steak in fat, add onion, tomatoes, and water.
Cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH FRIED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 6 medium onions
- 1 cup. flour
- Wesson oil or Snowdrift (for frying)
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add salt and flour, beat until free from lumps.
Slice onions about 1/4 inch thick, separate into rings, dip into batter.
Fry in hot grease a few at a time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIMA BEAN SCALLOP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. dried lima beans
- 3 cup. water
- 2 tsp. onion, finely chopped
- 5 Tbsp. shortening
- 4 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. evaporated milk
- 3/4 cup. liquid, drained from beans
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1/4 cup. bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash beans, soak overnight in 3 c. water.
Cook on simmer until tender (about 2 hours), drain, save liquid.
Cook onion in shortening until tender but not brown (5 minutes).
Blend in flour, salt, and pepper, add milk and bean liquid, stir until thickened.
Add cheese, stir until melted.
Layer beans and cheese sauce in greased casserole, sprinkle with bread crumbs.
Bake with oven meal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in baking dish, pour barbecue sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MILDRED SLATER'S CHOCOLATE DIVINITY CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/3 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 2/3 cup white Karo syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 6 oz Baker's bittersweet chocolate, melted
- 2 egg whites
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, water, and Karo syrup in a saucepan.
Stir until sugar dissolves, cover, and cook to the hard ball stage.
Pour slowly over well-beaten egg whites, beating constantly.
When cool and ready to drop, add melted chocolate, nuts, vanilla, and a pinch of salt.
Drop into desired shapes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TAMALE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs ground steak
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 heaping tbsp chili powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 heaping tsp comino powder
- 0.5 tsp black pepper
- Red pepper, to taste
- 1 quart boiling water
- 0.25 lb butter
- 3 cups white corn meal
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Brown meat lightly in a skillet with a small amount of fat.
Stir in mashed tomatoes, chili powder, salt, comino, black pepper, and red pepper; simmer for 1 hour.
Scald corn meal, then add slowly to boiling water, stirring constantly.
Season with butter and salt.
In a double boiler or baking dish, pour half the mush mixture, then the meat mixture, and cover with remaining mush.
Steam for 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 qts. water
- 1 tsp. whole cloves
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/3 cup tea or 15 tea bags
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 1 cup orange juice
- 3/4 cup fresh lemon juice
<|steps|>
Add spices to water.
Bring water to full boil.
Remove from heat.
Add tea immediately.
Brew 4 minutes.
Strain.
Add sugar, stir until dissolved.
Add fruit juices.
To reheat for serving place over low heat.
Do not boil.
Serves 25 to 30.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POTTED HAM ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- Ground boiled ham or canned potted ham
- Commercial mayonnaise (if using ground ham)
- Pie crust dough
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
<|steps|>
Season ham to taste, blending ground ham with mayonnaise if needed.
Prepare pie crust dough with Tabasco and celery seed.
Divide dough into two parts and roll out each into a thin, long oblong shape.
Spread with ham filling and roll up like a cinnamon roll.
Bake until golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DUTCH SANDWICH**
<|ingredients|>
- Rye bread rounds
- 1 small dill pickle, finely chopped
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, finely chopped
- 1 box imported sardines
- Mayonnaise, as needed
<|steps|>
Cut crusts off rye bread rounds.
Mash sardines and mix with chopped pickle, eggs, and enough mayonnaise to make a spreadable consistency.
Season to taste and spread on bread rounds.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5-2 lb chicken
- 0.5 cup flour
- 1 heaping tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- Hot grease, for frying
- Flour, remaining from fried chicken
- Hot grease, from frying
- Hot water, as needed
<|steps|>
Dress and cut up chicken for frying.
Sift flour, salt, and pepper into a clean paper bag.
Drop chicken pieces into the bag and shake until well floured.
Fry slowly in a skillet half full of hot grease until golden brown, turning after about 20 minutes per side.
Do not cover.
Remove to a platter when tender.
**GRAVY**
Add remaining flour to hot grease in the skillet and stir until brown.
Add enough hot water to make a thick gravy.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON CHEESE CAKE-PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. water
- 2 egg yolks
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 cup. cream cheese
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add water, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add lemon juice, butter, and cream cheese, stir until smooth.
Pour into pie crust, chill, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 cup sweet milk
- 2 cups flour
- 1.5 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar together.
Add eggs one at a time, beating until light.
Sift flour with baking powder three times, then add to mixture alternately with sweet milk.
Add vanilla and salt.
Bake in greased muffin tins in a 350°F oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOUISE'S MEAT BALLS AND ARTICHOKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 pound ground beef
- 1/4 pound ground pork
- 3 tablespoons minced parsley
- 1 small onion, chopped fine
- 3 slices white bread
- 1/2 cup hot milk
- 1 egg, beaten
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Fat, for frying
- 2 cups tomato juice (for sauce)
- 1 tablespoon Kitchen Bouquet (for sauce)
- Liquid from 1 can artichokes (for sauce)
- Artichoke hearts
<|steps|>
Remove crusts from bread and soak in hot milk.
Combine ground beef, ground pork, parsley, onion, soaked bread, beaten egg, salt, and pepper.
Form into small balls and fry lightly in fat until browned.
For the sauce, cook tomato juice, Kitchen Bouquet, and artichoke liquid for a few minutes.
Add browned meatballs and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add artichoke hearts just before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRISCO PIE CRUST**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2/3 cup. Crisco
- 5-6 Tbsp. cold water
<|steps|>
Mix flour and salt, cut in Crisco.
Add water, mix until dough forms.
Roll out to fit pie pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chops with salt and pepper.
Dip in egg mixed with milk, coat with bread crumbs.
Place in baking dish, bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERMILK CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 cup Crisco
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon water
- Buttermilk (to fill cup after water)
<|steps|>
Cream butter, Crisco, and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Dissolve baking soda in a cup with 1 tablespoon water, then quickly fill with buttermilk.
Add flour and buttermilk mixture alternately to the creamed mixture, mixing well.
Pour into a tube pan and place in a cold oven.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour to 1 hour and 10 minutes; do not open oven for the first 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROSTED FRUIT JUICE**
<|ingredients|>
- Mixture of desired fruit juices
- Grapefruit juice
- Lemon juice, for frosting
- Sugar, for frosting
- Cherries, for garnish
- Mint, for garnish
<|steps|>
Freeze the fruit juice mixture to a frappe stage.
Dip the rims of tall, thin glasses or ginger ale glasses in lemon juice, then in sugar, ensuring sugar doesn't run down the sides.
Fill glasses with the fruit juice frappe.
Pour grapefruit juice over the frappe.
Garnish with a cherry and mint.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 6 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Gradually add sifted flour and mix well.
Add vanilla.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- ¾ cup sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 packages gelatin
- 1 cup water
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- 1 cup cream, whipped
- Lettuce and mayonnaise for serving
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, lemon juice, sugar, and salt; bring to a boil.
Soak gelatin in water, then add to the hot pineapple mixture; beat vigorously and cool, stirring occasionally.
When the mixture begins to set, add grated cheese and whipped cream.
Pour into individual molds, an 8 x 12-inch pan, or a large ring mold; let congeal overnight.
Serve on lettuce, topped with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can pink salmon
- 1 large onion
- 3 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 apple
- Pepper and salt to taste
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Chop salmon, onion, eggs, and apple together.
Add mayonnaise, pepper, and salt, mix well.
Serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED CHEESE FILLING FOR CREAM PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grated American cheese
- 0.25 tsp prepared mustard
- 3 tbsp mayonnaise
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp grated onion
- 5-6 drops Tabasco sauce
- 0.25 tsp celery seeds
- 0.5 cup boiling water
- 0.25 cup butter or margarine
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 0.5 cup flour
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
For filling, mix cheese, mustard, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, onion, Tabasco, and celery seeds.
For puffs, boil water, butter, and salt; add flour all at once and beat over low heat until mixture forms a ball.
Remove from heat, cool slightly, and add eggs one at a time, beating well.
Beat until mixture has a satin-like sheen.
Drop 0.5 tsp dough per puff onto a baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until brown and puffy.
Fill puffs with cheese mixture, for 30-35 bite-sized puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON TARTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 cups boiling water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 4 egg yolks
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 3 lemons (grated rinds and juice, add more if needed)
- 4 egg whites (for meringue)
- Pinch of salt (for meringue)
- 8 tablespoons sugar (for meringue)
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, flour, and salt in a double boiler.
Gradually add boiling water and cook until smooth and thick, stirring constantly.
Add egg yolks one at a time, stirring between each addition, and cook for 5 more minutes.
Just before removing from heat, add lemon juice, grated rind, and butter. Mix well and cool.
Pour into a 9-inch baked pastry shell or individual shells.
For meringue, beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff.
Add sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating after each addition, and continue beating for 5 minutes.
Top the tarts with meringue and bake until golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN STICKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into very hot, well-greased corn stick molds.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE SPICE "DUMP" CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can sliced pie apples
- 1/3 cup brown sugar
- 1 box prepared spice cake mix
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 2 sticks oleo or butter
<|steps|>
Butter a cake pan well.
Pour in the can of pie apples with juice, sprinkle with brown sugar.
Add spice cake mix, sprinkle with pecans, and dot with sliced butter.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup boiling water
- 0.5 cup cocoa
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 2 egg yolks
- 0.75 cup sour milk
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp baking powder
- Pinch of salt
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine boiling water and cocoa, mixing well.
Combine sugar, shortening, egg yolks, and sour milk.
Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together.
Add dry ingredients and sugar mixture alternately to cocoa mixture.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites and vanilla.
Bake in an 8-inch square pan at 350°F for 35 minutes.
Cut into squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can English peas, drained
- 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup buttered bread crumbs
- 1 recipe Creole sauce
- 2 cups thick white sauce
- 3 tablespoons grated cheese
- Mustard, to taste
- Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Season the white sauce with mustard, Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, salt, and pepper to taste.
Add 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese to the white sauce and mix well.
Place buttered bread crumbs in the bottom of a casserole dish.
Layer alternately with drained peas, white sauce, and Creole sauce.
Finish with a sprinkle of 3 tablespoons grated cheese on top.
Bake in the oven until browned before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SNAP BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- Snap beans
- 0.25 lb streaked meat (salt pork)
- Water, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Wash and prepare beans for cooking.
Boil streaked meat in a vessel half full of water.
Add beans and salt, cooking for about 2-3 hours, adding more water if needed.
Add a little sugar to enhance flavor.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOBSTER THERMIDOR**
