<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- 1 tsp finely chopped onion
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 2 tbsp flour
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 can lobster meat or meat of 1 large or 2 small lobsters
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 3 slices bread
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook onion and green pepper in melted butter until soft.
Add flour and sweet milk, cooking until the cream sauce thickens.
Add lobster meat and chopped eggs.
Toast bread slices in a slow oven until crisp and dry.
Break one slice into small pieces and add to the lobster mixture in a baking dish.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll remaining two toast slices into fine crumbs, mix with grated cheese, and sprinkle over the top.
Bake in a moderate oven until nicely browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. GRAHAM'S FRUIT ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cups apples or other fruit
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 1/2 pound butter
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon fat
- Biscuit dough
<|steps|>
Add 1 tablespoon fat to biscuit dough and roll thin to 8 inches in diameter.
Spread with 3/4 of the butter and 1 cup sugar.
Slice apples thinly and spread 1 1/2 cups on one edge of the dough.
Fold ends over apples and roll up.
Place in a baking dish and cut through the top crust every 2 inches.
Combine remaining sugar, butter, and apples with 1 cup warm water, pour into the pan, and bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN TETRAZINNI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen or lg. fryer
- salt and pepper
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- 4 cans cream mushroom soup
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 4 sm. garlic cloves
- 4 med. onions, chopped
- 1/2 cup. chopped almonds
- 2 med. size bell peppers, chopped
<|steps|>
Boil hen until completely tender.
Cut into chunks.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling chicken broth until tender.
Chop together celery, peppers, onions and minced garlic.
Tenderize in little oil or fat.
Add to the spaghetti.
Add the chopped chicken and mushroom soup.
Add chopped almonds, salt and pepper.
Pour into casserole.
Cover with grated cheese.
Bake in moderate oven 30 to 40 minutes.
Number of servings: 8 to 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can tomatoes
- 1/4 cup. chopped olives
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 envelope Knox gelatin
- 1/4 cup. chopped sweet pickle
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in 1/2 c. tomato juice.
Heat tomatoes in saucepan, remove from fire when boiling, add gelatin and cheese, stir until dissolved.
Cool mixture, add olives and pickles.
Place in bowl or individual molds, refrigerate to congeal.
Serve with mayonnaise on crisp lettuce leaf.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BREAST OF CHICKEN ALMONDINE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 2.5 cups water
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 1 tsp instant minced onion
- 1 cup cream of mushroom soup
- 0.25 cup slivered almonds
- 2.25 tsp salt
- 3 large whole chicken breasts, halved
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 0.66 cup milk
- 2 tbsp butter
<|steps|>
Cook rice with 1 tsp salt in 2 cups water; bring to a boil, then simmer covered over low heat for 14 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 10 minutes.
Melt butter in a skillet, brown chicken breasts slowly on both sides, then drain.
Cook celery in 0.5 cup water, covered, until tender, about 8-10 minutes.
Spread rice in a greased 8x12x2-inch shallow baking dish.
Spread celery over rice, then place chicken skin side up.
Sprinkle chicken with 0.25 tsp salt, pepper, and onion.
Mix milk and mushroom soup, pour over chicken and rice.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Melt 2 tbsp butter, stir in almonds to coat, and spread over soup.
Bake 15 minutes more until almonds are brown, for 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EVERLASTING ICEBOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. warm water
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 eggs
- 5-6 cup. flour
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add to potato mixture with eggs.
Add flour to make soft dough, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, refrigerate, use as needed.
Shape into rolls, let rise, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WATERMELON RIND PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- 10 cups peeled watermelon rind
- 10 cups sugar
- 10 tbsp finely chopped orange peel
<|steps|>
Mix watermelon rind and sugar, letting stand overnight.
Add orange peel and cook until a clear, rich yellow color.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA CHOW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/4 cup water
- 2 cups chow mein noodles
- 1 can tuna fish
- 1 cup sliced celery
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1/4 cup salted cashew nuts
- Dash of pepper
- 1 can mandarin orange sections, drained
<|steps|>
Combine mushroom soup and water.
Add 1 cup chow mein noodles, tuna, celery, onion, cashew nuts, and pepper; toss lightly.
Place in an ungreased 1-quart baking dish and sprinkle remaining noodles on top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
Just before serving, top with drained mandarin orange sections.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT FONDANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cocoanut, grated
- 2 lbs granulated sugar
- Milk of cocoanut
- Water, as needed
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, cocoanut milk, and a little water; cook in a double boiler until a small amount creams when tested in a saucer.
Add to grated cocoanut and beat until it holds its shape when dropped onto a buttered plate.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BYRD'S RHUBARB GLACE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups uncooked rhubarb, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 1/2 cups brown sugar
- 1/2 cup butter or oleo
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 1 pint commercial mayonnaise
- 4 tablespoons Bahamian mustard
- 2 large cloves garlic, grated
- 1 tablespoon Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 cup chopped spring onion tops
- 2 tablespoons chives, drained
- 1/2 cup Hunt's tomato paste
<|steps|>
Heat bacon drippings in a heavy skillet, add rhubarb, cover, and stew for a few minutes.
Add brown sugar and butter, then simmer until the mixture reaches a preserve consistency.
Stir occasionally to prevent scorching.
Serve hot for breakfast with ham, bacon, or sausage and hot biscuits. Apples may be substituted for rhubarb.
**LOUIEWOOD SAUCE**
Remove any tissue from grated garlic and mix with tomato paste.
Add Bahamian mustard and mix well.
Combine with mayonnaise, then add onion tops and chives.
Let ripen for a few hours before serving.
Serve with fried or boiled shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- Biscuit dough (as for Southern Biscuit)
- Hot fat or cooking oil
<|steps|>
Roll biscuit dough thin and cut into finger-length strips, 1 inch across.
Drop into hot fat or cooking oil and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with fried chicken.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STROGANOFF**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 tablespoons flour
- 3 tablespoons shortening
- 2 pounds beef for stew, cut in 1/2-inch cubes
- 11/2 teaspoons salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 cup tomato juice
- 2 cups liquid (water and liquid from mushrooms)
- 2 bouillon cubes
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
- 1 cup sour cream
<|steps|>
Rub beef with garlic.
Combine 6 tablespoons flour, salt, and pepper, reserving 1 tablespoon flour for later; dredge meat in seasoned flour.
Brown meat in shortening in a skillet, then remove.
Sauté onion in skillet drippings, drain excess grease, and return meat to skillet.
Dissolve bouillon cubes in 1½ cups liquid, add to meat with tomato juice, cover, and simmer for 1½ hours.
Add mushrooms.
Combine reserved 1 tablespoon flour with remaining ½ cup liquid, add to skillet, and stir until mixture thickens.
Heat thoroughly and fold in sour cream just before serving.
Serve over cooked noodles or parsleyed rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup nuts
- 3 cups flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- 5 tsp baking powder
- 1 egg yolk
- 1 cup milk
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Bake in a moderate oven until done, making two small or one large loaf.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 2 No. 2 cans black, pitted cherries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 envelope Knox plain gelatin
<|steps|>
Take liquid from cherries and pineapple, finish out to 4 cups liquid.
Heat liquid, pour over Jell-O.
Soften gelatin in 2 Tbsp. water, add to Jell-O mixture, stir in cherries and pineapple.
Set in refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY SALAD SUPREME**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups raw cranberries
- 2 1/2 cups water
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 packages lemon Jell-O
- Juice of 1 pineapple
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup white grapes
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cook cranberries, sugar, and water until the berries are soft.
Add lemon Jell-O and pineapple juice to the mixture, then cool.
Stir in crushed pineapple, white grapes, and chopped nuts.
Pour into a large mold or individual molds.
Chill until set. Serves 14.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JELLY ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/3 cup. water
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. jelly
<|steps|>
Beat eggs and sugar until thick, add water and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, fold into egg mixture.
Pour into greased jelly roll pan, bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes.
Turn onto towel dusted with powdered sugar, roll up, cool, unroll, spread with jelly, reroll.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. E. M. FANT'S AMERICAN PLUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound shortening
- 1 pound currants
- 1 pound light bread crumbs (ground)
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup peach preserves
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 cup wine or whiskey
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
- 1 pound raisins
- 1 pound sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1 tablespoon cloves
- 1 tablespoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup citron, cut small
- 1/2 cup butter (for hard sauce)
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar (or 3/4 cup granulated sugar, for hard sauce)
- Nutmeg or 2/3 teaspoon vanilla and 1/3 teaspoon lemon extract (for hard sauce)
- Cream, as needed (for hard sauce)
<|steps|>
Mix shortening, currants, bread crumbs, baking soda, peach preserves, buttermilk, wine or whiskey, pecans, raisins, sugar, eggs, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and citron.
Thin with coffee or fruit juice if too thick.
Fill 1-pound coffee cans 3/4 full, cover, and steam for about 2 hours.
Cool in cans, then remove and wrap in paper. Optionally, return to cans and cover.
For hard sauce, cream butter and beat in confectioners' or granulated sugar.
Flavor with nutmeg or vanilla and lemon extract, adding cream to thin if desired.
Serve pudding with hard sauce. Makes 6 puddings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sqs. (2 oz.) unsweetened chocolate
- 2 tbsp. butter
- 1/3 cup. flour
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 1/2 cup. milk, scalded
- 3 eggs, separated
- 3/4 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate and butter over hot water in top of double boiler.
Mix flour, sugar and salt and stir into chocolate mixing until well blended.
Add 1 cup of the hot milk and stir until smooth.
Add remaining milk and continue to cook, stirring frequently until mixture is smooth and thickened, about 15 minutes.
Beat egg yolks well; stir in a little of the chocolate mixture, then pour back into rest of hot mixture and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.
Pour immediately into cooled pie shell.
Top with meringue or whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHESS PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter, melted
- 3 eggs
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, butter, eggs, vinegar, and vanilla.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLUEBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs, separated
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 1 8-oz pkg Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 1 cup blueberries, drained
- 1 cup blueberry juice
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
<|steps|>
Beat egg yolks and whites separately.
Mix yolks with 0.5 cup sugar, cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla, flour, and lemon juice.
Fold in egg whites and pour into two 8-inch pie crusts.
Bake at 325°F for 45 minutes.
For topping, cook blueberries, juice, 0.5 cup sugar, and cornstarch until thick.
Pour over cooled pies, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cocoa, and milk, cook to soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla, cool without stirring.
Beat until thick, add nuts if using, pour into greased pan, cut when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET PICKLED PEACHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs peaches
- 1 tsp mace
- 2 lbs sugar
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 pint apple vinegar
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp cloves
<|steps|>
Mix vinegar, sugar, mace, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves; bring to a good boil.
Add peaches and cook until very tender.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. quick oats
- 1/2 cup. raisins
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in oats and raisins.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOPPED EGGS AND GREEN PEPPER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons minced green peppers
- 1 tablespoon horseradish
- Mayonnaise, as needed
- 1 tablespoon Durkee's dressing
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix chopped eggs, green peppers, horseradish, mayonnaise, and Durkee's dressing.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spread on bread.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROILED GRAPEFRUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 grapefruit
- Butter, as needed
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- Maraschino cherry, for garnish
- 2 cups flour
- 3 eggs
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1/2 cup Wesson oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Cut grapefruit crosswise, remove seeds, snip out centers, and loosen each section.
Spread each grapefruit half with 1 tablespoon brown sugar and dot with butter.
Heat in a 325°F oven for about 15 minutes.
Place under a broiler to brown slightly.
Garnish with a Maraschino cherry before serving.
**WAFFLES**
Beat eggs with a rotary beater until very light and fluffy.
Thoroughly beat in Wesson oil, then add milk and beat well.
Sift salt and baking powder with flour.
Add dry ingredients to the liquid mixture, beating until thoroughly mixed.
Bake on a hot waffle iron.
Optionally, prepare the batter the night before and store in the refrigerator for breakfast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OYSTER CHOWDER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups cracker crumbs
- 4 tbsp butter
- 1 pint oysters
- 2 pieces pimento
- Milk, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Place 0.67 cup cracker crumbs in the bottom of a casserole.
Drain oysters and place half on crumbs.
Dot with butter, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and finely chopped pimento.
Add 0.67 cup crumbs, remaining oysters, salt, pepper, butter, and pimento.
Top with remaining crumbs.
Pour in enough milk to come just below the top.
Bake slowly at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE NUGGETS**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup shortening
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 (1 oz) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted and slightly cooled
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons instant coffee (dry)
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup quick-cooking rolled oats
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then beat in egg and vanilla.
Stir in melted chocolate.
Sift flour, salt, and instant coffee together; add to chocolate mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in rolled oats and nuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes or until done.
Dust with confectioners' sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TURNIP GREENS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 bunches turnip greens
- 0.25 lb streaked meat (salt pork)
- Water, as needed
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Pick off stems and wash greens thoroughly.
Boil streaked meat in a vessel half full of water.
Drop greens into the vessel and cook for at least 3 hours, adding salt and more water if needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WEDDING PUNCH FOR 100**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 lb. tea, brewed
- 2 large cans grapefruit juice
- 4 qts. gingerale
- 2 large cans pineapple juice
- 3 large cans frozen lemonade
- Sugar to taste
- 3 tbsp. tea leaves
- 4 cups boiling water
- 1 1/2 or 2 cups sugar
- 1 1/2 cups boiling water
- 8 whole cloves
- 6 oranges or 1 can concentrate
- 6 lemons or 1 can concentrate
- 1 46-oz. can pineapple juice
- 1 tsp. almond extract
- 3 qts. ice water or gingerale
- 1 bottle Maraschino cherry juice
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Adjust sugar to taste.
Serve chilled.
**PUNCH**
Steep tea in 4 cups boiling water 5 minutes.
Strain and cool.
Make a syrup by boiling 1 1/2 cups water, 1 1/2 cups sugar, cloves, 1 orange, 1 lemon peel for 5 minutes and cool.
When cool combine tea, syrup and other ingredients except chilled water or gingerale.
Allow to stand 1 hour or until ready to serve.
Add chilled water and chipped ice.
Serves 25.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. fat
- 1 cup. chicken broth
- 1/2 cup. cream
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Brown in fat, remove to baking dish.
Mix broth and cream, pour over chicken.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **YUMMY PORCUPINE MEATBALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (10 1/2 oz.) condensed tomato soup
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 1/4 cup. uncooked rice
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/4 cup. minced onion
- 2 tbsp. minced parsley
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 sm. clove garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp. shortening
- 1 cup. water
<|steps|>
Mix 1/4 cup soup with beef, rice, egg, onion, parsley and salt.
Shape into 1 1/2" balls (about 16).
Brown meatballs and garlic in shortening in skillet.
Blend in remaining soup and water.
Cover; simmer 40 minutes or until rice is tender; stir often.
4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 to 1 1/2 lbs. boneless beef, cut in 1 1/2" pieces
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 4 tbsp. shortening
- 2 cup. boiling water
- minced garlic, opt.
- 4 med. potatoes
- 1 bay leaf
- 2 tsp. salt
- 4 carrots
- 1 cup. chopped onion
<|steps|>
Roll meat in flour and brown with onion slowly for 15 minutes.
Add the bay leaf, half the water and half the salt.
Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add vegetables, remaining water and salt and garlic.
Cover again and cook 30 minutes more.
Thicken gravy with 3 tablespoons browned flour.
Serves 4.
Never boil a stew. Let it simmer gently.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box cherry (or any red) gelatin
- 1 large bottle stuffed Spanish olives
- 1 large can Bing (or black) cherries
- 1/2 tablespoon sherry or bourbon
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Chopped almonds or pecans, for garnish
- Homemade mayonnaise, for serving
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in 1 cup hot cherry juice.
Cool with 1/2 cup cherry juice mixed with lemon juice and sherry or bourbon.
Pour into individual salad molds and chill until set.
Serve with homemade mayonnaise and garnish with chopped almonds or pecans.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 eggs
- 0.5 cup sour milk
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp cloves
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 0.5 tsp baking powder
- 1 cup blackberry jam
- White or mocha icing, for topping
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Separate eggs, add beaten yolks, then sour milk with dissolved baking soda.
Sift flour with cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, and baking powder; add to mixture.
Stir in jam, then fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake in layer pans in a moderate oven.
Ice with white or mocha icing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BRITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 cup. peanuts
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to 275°F, add peanuts and butter.
Cook to 300°F, remove from heat, add baking soda and salt, stir.
Pour onto greased slab, spread thin, break when cool.
**DIVINITY**
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to hard ball stage (250°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff, slowly pour in hot syrup, beating constantly.
Add vanilla and nuts, beat until mixture holds shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**PRALINES**
Cook sugar, brown sugar, and milk to soft ball stage (235°F).
Add butter and pecans, cook 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, beat until thick.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**FUDGE**
Cook sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa to soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, cool without stirring.
Beat until thick, add nuts if using, pour into greased pan, cut when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 doz. ears corn
- 1 head cabbage
- 3 sweet red peppers
- 1 Tbsp. celery seed
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 cup. sugar
<|steps|>
Cook corn for 3 minutes in boiling water to set milk, cool, cut from cob.
Cook all ingredients together for 20 minutes.
Pack into clean, hot jars, process.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 cup. flour
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. oats
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cook dates, sugar, and water until thick, cool.
Mix flour, brown sugar, oats, butter, baking soda, and salt until crumbly.
Press half of crumb mixture into greased 8x8 pan, spread with date filling, top with remaining crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORNMEAL PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 45-50 minutes until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. WHEELER'S STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- Pie pastry dough
- 1/2 quart strawberries
- Sugar, to taste
- Butter, for brushing
- Whipped cream
- Whole strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Roll pie pastry dough very thin and make 3 layers to fit a 6-inch pie plate.
Bake in a hot oven until browned.
Butter each layer while hot.
Crush strawberries, sweeten to taste, and fill between layers.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with whole strawberries.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HORSERADISH ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Cream cheese
- Grated horseradish
- Chopped beef slices (2 inches in diameter)
<|steps|>
Mash cream cheese with a fork and stir in grated horseradish until seasoned.
Spread the mixture on chopped beef slices and roll up.
Place face down on a plate and chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPINACH RING WITH GARNISHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can chopped spinach
- 1 tablespoon butter or bacon drippings
- 1 1/2 eggs
- 2 slices bread, soaked in water
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Parslied potato balls, for garnish
- Buttered carrot spears, for garnish
- Mushroom sauce (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook spinach in butter or bacon drippings until all juice is evaporated.
Add eggs and squeezed-out bread slices to the spinach.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste.
Pour into a buttered ring mold and bake at 250°F for 30 minutes.
Unmold onto a serving dish.
Fill the center with parslied potato balls and arrange buttered carrot spears at the base.
Optionally, serve with mushroom sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AD'S MACARONI LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup macaroni
- 1 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon chopped pimento
- 1 tablespoon chopped green pepper
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 2 cups bread crumbs
- 3 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 tablespoon chopped parsley
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Campbell's tomato soup, for sauce
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until stiff, then add yolks and beat.
Boil macaroni in salted water and drain.
Scald milk, add bread crumbs, butter, cheese, pimento, green pepper, parsley, salt, pepper, and eggs.
Pour into a pan lined with well-greased paper.
Set in a pan of hot water and bake at 325°F for about 1 hour.
Serve with tomato sauce made by adding water to Campbell's tomato soup.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thin batter.
Beat well and cook on a hot griddle, like pancakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN FRIED CORN**
<|ingredients|>
- 5-6 ears corn
- 2 cups cold water
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 tbsp bacon drippings or lard
<|steps|>
Cut corn from cobs, removing about half the kernels, then scrape cobs thoroughly to get all the milk.
Add cold water, salt, and pepper.
Cook in a skillet with hot bacon drippings or lard, stirring constantly over medium heat until the mixture thickens.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS VINAIGRETTE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can asparagus spears
- 1 cup olive oil
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 cucumber pickle
- Shredded lettuce
- 1 small onion
- 1/3 cup tarragon vinegar
- Pinch of cayenne pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cracked black pepper
- 2 pimentos
- 1 green pepper
- Few sprigs parsley
<|steps|>
Drain and chill asparagus spears thoroughly.
Mix dry ingredients (paprika, salt, sugar, cayenne, black pepper), then add olive oil and tarragon vinegar, beating well.
Pour the vinaigrette over the asparagus and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Arrange shredded lettuce in a salad bowl, place asparagus on top, and pour the marinade over.
Garnish with sliced cucumber pickle, onion, pimentos, green pepper, and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PILAU**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1 cup. rice
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 cup. chicken broth
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in broth until tender, remove, debone.
Sauté onion and celery, add rice, salt, and pepper.
Add broth and chicken, simmer 20 minutes until rice is tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERSCOTCH PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. white sugar
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. veg. shortening or oleo
- 2 eggs
- 1 #303 can fruit cocktail with juice
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1 cup. white sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 sm. can evap. milk
- 1 stick butter or oleo
<|steps|>
Sift together the first 5 dry ingredients. (If self rising flour is used omit salt and baking powder.)
Blend in shortening, beaten eggs, then add fruit cocktail, including juice.
Pour into greased 9x13" pan.
Smooth down and sprinkle with the brown sugar and pecans.
Bake at 325 degrees 45 minutes.
**TOPPING**
Combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter and cook 2 minutes.
Add vanilla and spread over cake while both are still hot.
Sprinkle with 1/2 cup flaked coconut.
To serve hot or cold cut in squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRAPEFRUIT DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg yolks
- 3 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Salt, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 1 pint cream, stiffly whipped
<|steps|>
Cook egg yolks, butter, and sugar, stirring until thick.
Remove from heat, add lemon juice, salt, and paprika, and return to cook until thick.
Remove, beat well, and cool.
Fold in whipped cream.
Serve with grapefruit or fruit salads.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE MARSHMALLOW CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 tbsp. cocoa
- 4 eggs
- 1 1/3 cup. flour
- 4 cup. nuts
- 1 1/2 cup. Crisco
- 5 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 3/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. lemon flavoring
<|steps|>
Bake 40 minutes at 350 degrees in 11x14" pan.
While cake is cooking, cut marshmallows in half.
Remove cake promptly and place cut marshmallows on it as fast as possible so they will melt while the cake is hot.
**Icing:**
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 2 tablespoons cocoa
- 5 tablespoons milk
Mix ingredients and cover cake with icing.
**POUND CAKE WITH CRISP CRUST**
Cream Crisco and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time.
Beat well.
Add flour.
Do not over beat.
Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour or 5 or 10 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb flour
- 1 lb butter
- 1.5 lbs sugar
- 10 eggs
- 1.5 lbs seeded raisins
- 1 lb shelled pecans
- 0.25 lb citron
- 1 grated nutmeg
- 0.5 pint whiskey, wine, or brandy
<|steps|>
Dredge raisins, pecans, and citron with part of the flour.
Melt butter, add sugar, then eggs one at a time.
Add remaining flour, then floured fruit and nuts, nutmeg, and whiskey.
Steam for 3 hours, then bake in a moderate oven for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA WAFER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sticks oleo
- 2 cups sugar
- 6 eggs
- 1 box (12 oz) vanilla wafers
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 can (7 oz) angel flake coconut
<|steps|>
Cream oleo and sugar.
Crush vanilla wafers until very fine.
Add wafers to creamed mixture alternately with milk and eggs; blend well.
Add pecans and coconut.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1½ hours or until firm and golden brown.
Let cool in the pan before removing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED FISH**
<|ingredients|>
- Fish, medium pieces
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.5 tsp black pepper
<|steps|>
Clean and cut fish into medium pieces.
Sift corn meal, salt, and pepper together.
Dip fish in meal mixture and fry in deep, hot fat until golden brown.
Serve with corn pone.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN OR TURKEY TETRAZZINI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp red pepper
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- 4 tbsp sherry
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 0.5 cup bell pepper, chopped
- 2 tbsp margarine or butter
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 4-oz can mushrooms
- 5 tbsp milk
- 2 cups cooked chicken or turkey, diced
- 1 cup sharp grated cheese
- 0.5 cup almonds, cut in small pieces
- 1 small pkg noodles, cooked
<|steps|>
Brown onion and bell pepper in margarine until light brown.
Add soup, salt, red pepper, Worcestershire sauce, 0.5 cup cheese, milk, and sherry; stir until cheese melts.
Add chicken or turkey, mushrooms, and almonds.
Layer noodles and mixture in a casserole dish, topping with remaining cheese and almonds.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes, adding chicken stock if more liquid is needed, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FIG CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 cup fig juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 quart canned figs or 2 (1-pound 1 oz) jars, drained and chopped
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch
- 1 cup brown sugar, packed
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1¾ cups sifted confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Cream 1 cup butter and sugar, then beat in eggs.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and cloves together.
Combine buttermilk and 2/3 cup fig juice; add alternately with dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, beating until smooth.
Add vanilla, then fold in figs (reserving 2/3 cup for filling) and pecans.
Pour into two greased 8-inch round pans and bake at 325°F for over 1 hour.
For the filling, cook cornstarch with 1/3 cup fig juice until clear, then fold in reserved 2/3 cup figs; spread between layers.
For the frosting, melt ½ cup butter, add brown sugar, and boil over low heat for 2 minutes, stirring.
Add ¼ cup milk, bring to a boil, and cool.
Add confectioners' sugar, beat until smooth, and frost the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE OR PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 cup chopped prunes
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp Karo syrup
- 1 stick margarine or butter
<|steps|>
Mix oil and 1.5 cups sugar, then add eggs, 1 cup buttermilk, flour, 1 tsp each of baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and vanilla.
Flour pecans and prunes with some flour, then add to mixture.
Pour into a greased, floured 8x8x2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.
For sauce, cook 1 cup sugar, 1 cup buttermilk, 1 tsp baking soda, Karo, and margarine to soft ball stage; add 1 tsp vanilla.
Pour hot sauce over warm cake and let stand until absorbed.
Cut into squares, for 8 large servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. quick oats
- 1 1/2 cup. boiling water
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Pour boiling water over oats, let stand 20 minutes.
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt, add to creamed mixture with oats.
Pour into greased pan, bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes.
For topping, melt butter, milk, and brown sugar, stir in coconut, spread on cake, broil until bubbly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MORGAN'S MAYONNAISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 pint Wesson oil
<|steps|>
Break egg into a mixing bowl, add salt and lemon juice, and beat well.
Slowly add Wesson oil, beating continuously until thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 oz. corn starch
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 cup cold water
- 1 1/2 ounces white Karo
- 1 1/2 ounces strawberry gelatin
- 1/8 ounce red coloring if desired
- 1 pint of fresh strawberries
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn starch, and salt.
Add cold water and Karo, bring to a boil and cook until thick and totally clear, about 4 minutes.
Mixture must be clear before removing from heat.
Add strawberry gelatin and red coloring, mix well and cool.
Place strawberries in a 10" baked pie shell.
Pour base over strawberries.
Place in refrigerator and chill about 1 1/2 hours or until firm.
Serve with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CUCUMBER PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 gallon cucumbers
- 1.5 lbs brown sugar
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 2 tbsp mustard seed
- 2 tbsp turmeric
- 2 onions, chopped
- Several pieces horseradish, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp black pepper
- 1 pod red pepper
- 0.5 gallon vinegar
<|steps|>
Boil vinegar, brown sugar, celery seed, mustard seed, turmeric, onions, horseradish, black pepper, and red pepper for 30 minutes.
Pour over cucumbers.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON JELLO CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lemon gelatin
- 1 box lemon cake mix
- 3/4 cup. Wesson oil
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. lemon extract
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in water and let cool slightly.
Add this to the cake mix, then add egg and cooking oil.
After this mixture has cooled, pour into tube pan and bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups flour
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 2 tsp salt
- 1 cup warm sweet milk
- 2 cakes yeast, dissolved in warm water
- 2 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup flour, for rolling
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together and let rise for 2 hours.
Roll out, cut into rolls using about 1 cup of flour.
Let rise for 1 hour.
Bake in a moderate oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN TOMATO PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 lb. full-grown green tomatoes
- 2 gal. water
- 3 cup. powdered lime
- 5 lb. sugar
- 3 pt. vinegar
- 2 heaping Tbsp. whole, mixed spice (in bag)
<|steps|>
Wash tomatoes, cut out stems, slice 1/4 inch thick.
Soak in lime and water in a large pot for 24 hours.
Soak in clear water for 4 hours, changing water every 30 minutes.
Drain well, place in large pot.
Mix sugar and vinegar in another pot, bring to a rolling boil, pour over tomatoes, let stand overnight.
Add spice bag, cook slowly for 1 hour.
Put in jars and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED RIBS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs. spareribs
- 1 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season ribs with salt and pepper, place in baking dish.
Mix barbecue sauce and onion, pour over ribs.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. peanut butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter, peanut butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls, flatten with fork, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **YUM YUM PINEAPPLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 2 Tbsp. gelatin
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped green pepper
- 1/2 pt. cream, beaten stiff
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped pimientos
- 1/2 cup. sugar
<|steps|>
Heat pineapple, add lemon juice and sugar, stir until sugar dissolves.
Soak gelatin in 1/2 c. cold water for 10 minutes, add to hot mixture.
When cool and beginning to set, add cheese, cream, green pepper, and pimientos.
Mix thoroughly, put in mold, refrigerate until firm.
Remove from molds, serve on lettuce with dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JELLIED TUNA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can tuna
- 0.75 cup celery, finely chopped
- 1 pimento
- 1 tbsp onion juice
- Small bottle stuffed green olives, sliced
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 4 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 envelope gelatine
- 0.25 cup cold water
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Salt, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes, then melt over hot water.
Add gelatine to mayonnaise.
Combine tuna, celery, pimento, onion juice, olives, green pepper, eggs, salt, cayenne, and paprika.
Add mayonnaise mixture and mix thoroughly.
Pour into individual molds or one large mold and chill until firm.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FAVORITE PARTY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can sliced pineapple
- 1 small bottle cherries
- 1 pound marshmallows
- 1 pound shelled pecans
- 1 pint whipping cream
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons vinegar
- 3 tablespoons water
<|steps|>
Cut marshmallows into quarters, drain and cut pineapple and cherries into small pieces, and chop pecans.
Mix marshmallows, fruit, pecans, and lemon juice.
For the dressing, combine slightly beaten egg yolks, vinegar, and water in a double boiler; cook until thick.
Cool dressing, add salt and whipped cream, and mix thoroughly with the salad.
Place in a large covered bowl or pour into 18 individual molds; refrigerate for 24 hours.
Serve on crisp lettuce with cheese crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AVOCADO STUFFED CELERY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup mashed avocado
- 2 tablespoons grated horseradish
- 1/2 tablespoon Tabasco sauce
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix mashed avocado, horseradish, Tabasco, and salt.
Fill celery stalks with the mixture.
Chill before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED CANADIAN BACON**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon dry mustard
- 2 cups unsweetened pineapple juice
- 2 pounds Canadian bacon, in one piece
<|steps|>
Combine brown sugar, dry mustard, and pineapple juice.
Spread mixture over the Canadian bacon.
Bake uncovered at 325°F for 1 hour, basting every 15 minutes.
Slice into 1-inch slices and serve with broiled pineapple slices on top of each slice, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAPPY DAY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tbsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Sift flour once, measure, sift flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Add milk and beat at high speed for 2 minutes.
Add egg whites and vanilla and beat 1 more minute at medium speed.
Pour into 2 8 greased cake pans and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done.
Stack with favorite filling.
Delicious with 7 minute frosting and coconut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening or salad oil
- 1 to 2 cups dried apricots, washed and drained
- 1 tablespoon grated orange rind (optional)
<|steps|>
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into a small bowl.
Add egg, milk, and shortening; mix until just blended, about 30 seconds.
Cut apricots into fourths with scissors and fold into the batter with orange rind, being careful not to overmix.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 55-60 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool before cutting.
**By Hand:** Beat egg, then mix with milk and shortening; add to sifted dry ingredients, blend, fold in apricots and orange rind, and bake as above.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1 pkg strawberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg cherry Jell-O
- 1 can Bing cherries
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 2 small bottles Coca-Cola, cold
- 2 small pkgs cream cheese, chopped
<|steps|>
Drain juice from cherries and pineapple to make 2 cups.
Heat juice and dissolve Jell-O; cool to syrup stage in refrigerator.
Add Coca-Cola, pineapple, cherries, nuts, and cream cheese.
Pour into a glass container and congeal, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD DE LUXE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large ears of corn, cut from cob and scraped, or 1 can (No. 2) cream-style corn
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/4 pound longhorn cheese, diced
- 1 small can chili, cut fine
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup shortening, oil, oleo, or butter
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a well-greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan or 8-inch iron skillet.
Bake at 375°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RUBY'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 pint heavy cream
- Chopped nuts, as needed
- 1 cake dot chocolate
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Add beaten egg yolks and 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar to the chocolate.
Whip cream with 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, then add stiffly beaten egg whites and vanilla.
Line the bottom of an ice tray with finely chopped nuts.
Layer cooled chocolate mixture, whipped cream, and another layer of chocolate.
Top with finely chopped nuts.
Freeze until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROWNIE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 3 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 cup cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Cream butter and shortening until fluffy.
Gradually add sugar and beat until thoroughly mixed.
Add eggs one at a time, beating until smooth.
Add flour and cocoa alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour.
Pour into a greased tube pan and sprinkle chopped pecans on top.
Place in a cold oven, then bake at 300°F for 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG-PLANT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 Tbsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 cup. sweet milk
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. celery salt
- 1/4 tsp. onion salt
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Pare and slice eggplant, sprinkle salt over slices, let stand 1 hour.
Drain, rinse, dice, cook until tender, drain, mash.
Make sauce of flour, milk, and margarine, cook until thick, add paprika, celery salt, onion salt, and cheese.
Pour into baking dish, sprinkle with crumbs, bake at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls or press through cookie press, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TURKEY OR CHICKEN DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups crumbled corn bread
- 2 cups crumbled soda biscuit
- Rich, hot turkey stock, as needed
- 2 onions, chopped
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- Salt, to taste
- 1 gallon green peppers
- 6 large onions
- 0.5 gallon vinegar
- 2 tsp salt
- 2 tsp black pepper
- 2 tsp allspice
- 0.5 cup brown sugar
- 3 pints good vinegar
- 0.25 cup soft butter
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 0.5 tbsp anchovy paste
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes or equal amount fresh tomatoes
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1.5 tsp salt
- 1 tsp horseradish
- 0.25 tsp Tabasco sauce
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 3 tbsp catsup
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Chili sauce, optional
- Allspice, optional
<|steps|>
Mix corn bread and soda biscuit in a deep bowl.
Add turkey stock to moisten thoroughly, then add onions, celery, eggs, milk, and salt.
Adjust with more stock if too stiff, aiming for corn bread batter consistency.
Place in and around turkey to bake.
**BARBARA SAUCE**
Boil green peppers, onions, and 0.5 gallon vinegar until tender and soft.
Mash well and season with salt, black pepper, allspice, and brown sugar.
Return to heat and boil for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat, add 3 pints vinegar, and seal in jars.
**LEMON ANCHOVY SAUCE**
Combine butter with lemon juice.
Add anchovy paste and mix well.
Serve on fish, green asparagus, or broccoli.
**RED SAUCE FOR MEAT OR BLACK EYED PEAS**
Cook all ingredients together over slow heat until the consistency of chili sauce.
Serve hot.
**SHRIMP COCKTAIL SAUCE**
Mix horseradish, Tabasco, lemon juice, catsup, salt, and Worcestershire sauce well.
Add chili sauce and allspice if desired.
Serve on chilled shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. dried beans
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/4 lb. sliced salt pork
- 2 Tbsp. or more dark molasses
- 2 or 3 Tbsp. catsup
- 1 Tbsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. boiling bean water
- Well-seasoned stock or reserved bean water (as needed)
- 1 pkg. lemon Jell-O
- 1 pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 pt. cream, whipped
<|steps|>
Soak beans covered overnight.
Cover with water, bring to boil, simmer slowly for 30 minutes or until skins burst when blown on, drain, reserve cooking water.
Add onion, salt pork, molasses, catsup, mustard, salt, and 1/2 c. boiling bean water.
Place in greased baker, decorate with salt pork, bake covered at 250°F for 6-8 hours.
Add stock or reserved bean water if dry, uncover for last hour.
**CONGEALED SALAD (RECIPE 1)**
Dissolve Jell-O in 1 c. boiling water, use pineapple juice for 1 c. liquid.
When Jell-O begins to congeal, add cream cheese, pineapple, nuts, celery, and whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HERSHEY BAR CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sticks margarine
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2.25 cups flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 0.5 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp vanilla
- 8 small Hershey bars, melted
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and margarine, then add eggs, beating well after each.
Alternate flour (mixed with baking soda and salt) and buttermilk into creamed mixture.
Melt Hershey bars in a double boiler and fold into batter.
Fold in nuts.
Bake in a greased round cake pan at 300°F for 1.25 hours, for 10-12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups leftover pot roast or 1 pound ground beef
- 1 large onion, coarsely cut
- 3 stalks celery, coarsely cut
- 1 green pepper, coarsely cut
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 can (101/2 oz) mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash of black pepper
- 1 can (3 oz) chow mein noodles
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 325°F.
If using ground beef, cook until browned in 1 tablespoon butter; if using pot roast, chop into small cubes and cook for several minutes in 1 tablespoon butter.
Transfer beef to a medium-sized casserole dish.
In the same pan, add remaining butter and cook chopped onion, celery, and green pepper until limp.
Stir in mushroom soup, water, salt, and pepper, then pour over beef in the casserole dish and mix well.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove cover, sprinkle chow mein noodles on top, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope gelatin
- 1/4 cup. cold water
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 baked pie crust
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Heat orange juice, sugar, and salt, add gelatin, stir until dissolved.
Cool, add lemon juice, fold in whipped cream.
Pour into pie crust, chill until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/3 cup. white Karo
- 1/2 cup. sweet milk
- 2 level tbsp. butter
- 2 heaping tbsp. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, Karo, milk, butter, and cocoa.
Cook to soft ball stage.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and beat until thick.
Pour into buttered dish and cut into squares when cool.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE STRAWS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Mix flour, salt, and cayenne, cut in butter.
Add cheese, mix to form dough.
Roll out, cut into strips.
Bake at 400°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE CRISPIES CRUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 lb chopped dates
- 1 egg
- 0.5 cup nuts
- 2 cups Rice Krispies
- Coconut, for rolling
<|steps|>
Melt margarine and sugar, add dates and egg.
Cook until thick, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly.
Cool, then add nuts and Rice Krispies.
Shape into balls and roll in coconut, for about 24 balls.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For icing, melt brown sugar, butter, and milk, boil 2 minutes, cool, add powdered sugar, beat until smooth, spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP CREOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs large shrimp
- 4 tbsp fat
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp green pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp parsley, chopped
- 0.5 tsp sugar
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes
- 1 cup water
<|steps|>
Boil shrimp for 20 minutes, peel, and remove black veins (or use canned shrimp).
Heat fat in a large skillet, add flour, and stir until brown.
Add onion, tomatoes, water, shrimp, bay leaf, garlic, green pepper, parsley, and sugar.
Cook slowly for 40 minutes.
Serve over boiled rice on a large platter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package lemon Jell-O
- 1 cup boiling water
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 1/2 pint heavy cream, whipped
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water and cool slightly.
Add crushed pineapple with its juice and grated cheese.
Fold in whipped cream.
Pour into a mold and chill until set.
Unmold onto lettuce leaves to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 1/4 cup. warm water
- 1 cup. milk, scalded
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. pecans
<|steps|>
Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Mix milk, sugar, shortening, and salt, cool, add yeast, egg, and flour, knead until smooth.
Let rise until doubled, punch down, roll out.
Spread with butter, brown sugar, and pecans, roll up, cut into slices.
Place in greased pan, let rise, bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHRISTMAS PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart bread crumbs
- Cold water, for soaking
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup molasses
- 1 cup raisins
- 0.25 cup currants
- 1 tsp ginger
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 0.5 tsp cloves
- 0.5 tsp allspice
- 1 tbsp shortening
- 1 tsp baking soda
- Hot water, for dissolving
- Hard sauce, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak bread crumbs in cold water until soft, then squeeze dry.
Add sugar, molasses, raisins, currants, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and shortening.
When ready to steam, dissolve baking soda in a little hot water and add.
Steam in a double boiler for 4 hours.
Serve with hard sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRULA ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 2 quarts sweet milk
- 3/4 pound butter
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 pint cream
<|steps|>
Scald milk and add beaten eggs.
Cook over low heat until it reaches custard consistency.
Melt sugar and butter in a skillet until browned.
Add the milk and egg mixture to the skillet, then stir in pecans.
Mix well and freeze.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRESERVED PEARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 quarts pears
- 1 quart sugar
- Water, to moisten
- Ginger or pineapple, optional
<|steps|>
Select smooth, sweet pears; peel, halve, and remove cores, dropping into cold water to prevent blackening.
Heat sugar and water until warm, then add pears.
Cook slowly for several hours until syrup is thick.
Add ginger or pineapple for flavor if desired.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. cream cornstarch
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 cup. tomato juice
- 1 Tbsp. salt (for dressing)
- 1/2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 3/4 cup. salad oil
<|steps|>
Combine cream cornstarch, salt, and vinegar, gradually add tomato juice, heat to boiling, boil 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Pour into individual molds rinsed in cold water, chill until firm, about 3 hours.
Serve on lettuce, top with French dressing.
For French dressing, put dry ingredients in pint jar, add vinegar and salad oil, seal jar, shake vigorously.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED OYSTERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 bunches green onions, including tops, chopped
- 6 stalks celery, finely chopped
- 1 large bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp parsley, chopped
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pint oysters, chopped, with liquid
- 0.5 stick margarine
- 0.125 tsp black pepper
- 0.5 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Sauté green onions, celery, bell pepper, and parsley in margarine.
Add flour, oysters, oyster liquid, Worcestershire sauce, black pepper, and salt.
Cook until thickened.
Serve in small bite-size patty shells, piping hot, for about 20 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARROZ CON POLLO (CHICKEN WITH RICE)**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stewing chicken, cut into pieces (save 4 cups broth)
- 11/2 pounds small shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 cans mushrooms, stems and pieces
- 1 box frozen English peas
- 1 can (4 oz) pimento, sliced
- 2 small onions, chopped fine
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped fine
- 2 cups canned tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 2 teaspoons paprika
- 4 tablespoons fat
- 2 cups raw rice
- 1/2 cup parsley, chopped
<|steps|>
Boil chicken and save 4 cups of broth.
Brown rice in hot fat.
Add chicken broth, bring to a boil, and simmer.
When rice is half done, add frozen peas, cubed chicken pieces, whole shrimp, mushrooms, pimento, onion, green pepper, salt, paprika, and tomatoes.
Simmer until peas, shrimp, and rice are done, stirring occasionally with a fork.
Ensure all broth is absorbed.
Garnish with parsley.
Serve with guacamole in a lettuce cup, garnished with tomato wedges in a Mexican atmosphere.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can cream-style corn
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup. chopped pimiento
- 1/4 cup. chopped Bell pepper
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. salt
- 10 crackers, rolled fine
- 3 Tbsp. chopped onions
- 3 Tbsp. chopped celery
- 1 cup. sweet milk
<|steps|>
Beat eggs, add melted butter, blend in remaining ingredients.
Pour into greased baking dish.
Bake at 400°F for 45 minutes.
Can be prepared day before, stored in refrigerator.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET POTATO MARSHMALLOW BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (No. 2) sweet potatoes, drained
- 2 cups gingersnap crumbs, crushed
- 1 tablespoon undiluted frozen orange juice
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- Cloves, to taste
- Allspice, to taste
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 (6 oz) package marshmallows
<|steps|>
Mash sweet potatoes, then add cinnamon, cloves, allspice, brown sugar, and orange juice.
Form a ball around 3 small marshmallows or 1 large marshmallow.
Roll in gingersnap crumbs and chopped pecans.
Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 425°F for 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT BUTTERED PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 cup water
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- ¾ teaspoon cloves
- 2 cans jellied cranberries
- 3 cups water
- 1 quart pineapple juice
- Butter, for serving
<|steps|>
Bring brown sugar, 1 cup water, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves to a boil.
Crush cranberry sauce with a fork or mixer, add 3 cups water, and beat until smooth.
Add cranberry liquid and pineapple juice to the spiced syrup and heat to boiling.
Serve hot, with dots of butter in each cup of punch.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. hot mashed potatoes (white sweet potatoes)
- 2/3 cup. evap. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 stick oleo
- 5 eggs
<|steps|>
Add sugar and oleo to hot potatoes and let melt.
Add milk, then eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla and blend well.
Pour in unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NATALIE'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 dozen lady fingers
- 1 cup unsalted butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 3 squares (2 oz each) Baker's chocolate
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 4 eggs, separated
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- Whipped cream, for decoration
- Chopped nuts, for garnish
- Red cherries, for garnish
<|steps|>
In a double boiler, melt chocolate, granulated sugar, and water until smooth.
Gradually add well-beaten egg yolks and cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Cool, then cream butter and confectioners' sugar, and add the chocolate mixture.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites, vanilla, and a pinch of salt.
Line the bottom and sides of a pan with lady fingers.
Pour in the chocolate mixture and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Decorate with whipped cream, chopped nuts, and red cherries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEAFOAM SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jello
- 1 lg. cream cheese
- 1 med. can pears
- 1 carton whipping cream
<|steps|>
Drain pears and cut into bite size.
Heat 1 cup of pear juice and dissolve the Jello.
Have cream cheese at room temperature and add to pear juice and Jello while it is warm.
Refrigerate and start to congeal.
Add 1 cup of whipped cream and pears.
Congeal.
Cut into squares and serve on lettuce topped with mayonnaise and cherry.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEEP SOUTH PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 6 lemons
- 1 pint sherry
- 1 pint claret
- 1 pint club soda
- Large lump of ice
<|steps|>
Dissolve sugar in lemon juice.
Add sherry and claret, mixing well.
Pour into a bowl with a large lump of ice.
Add club soda and serve in punch cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KEY LIME PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. condensed milk
- 1/2 cup. lime juice
- 4 egg yolks
- 1 egg white
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites stiff.
Fold into condensed milk, lime juice, and egg yolks mixture.
Beat other 3 whites, add 6 tablespoons sugar gradually, 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar.
Put into baked pie shell.
Top with meringue.
Bake at 350 degrees till golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEVEN MINUTE FROSTING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 egg whites
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/3 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine egg whites, sugar, water, and cream of tartar in double boiler.
Beat over boiling water for 7 minutes until stiff peaks form.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, beat until spreadable.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 1 Tbsp. orange zest
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. orange juice (for glaze)
- 1 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 3 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with orange juice and zest.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For glaze, mix sugar and orange juice, pour over warm cake.
**BROWN SUGAR POUND CAKE**
Cream butter, brown sugar, and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 325°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOSSIE'S MARSHMALLOW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 1/2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1 teaspoon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 can diced pineapple
- 1 can seeded white cherries
- 2 boxes marshmallows, cut
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
In a double boiler, cook sugar, flour, vinegar, mustard, salt, butter, and egg yolks until thick.
Thin the mixture with half-cut or plain cream.
Add pineapple, cherries, and marshmallows.
Let stand for several hours.
Fold in whipped cream before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ESCALLOPED EGGPLANT WITH TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium eggplants
- 0.33 cup oil for sautéing
- Flour for dredging
- 1 can tomatoes
- 2 tbsp minced onion
- 1 tbsp margarine
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 0.25 cup minced parsley
<|steps|>
Peel eggplants, cut into 0.75-inch fingers, sprinkle with salt, and let stand for 1 hour.
Drain, dry between paper towels, dredge lightly with flour, and sauté in oil until lightly browned.
For tomato sauce, sauté onions in margarine until tender.
Add tomatoes, salt, pepper, and parsley; simmer for 20 minutes, then strain to remove seeds and pulp.
Arrange eggplant and tomato sauce in alternate layers in a baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK AND EASY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/2 cup. butter, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut or 1 cup. fruit preserves
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
Stir in coconut or fruit preserves.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN BAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can cheddar cheese soup
- 1/3 cup milk
- 3 cups cooked and drained French-style green beans (fresh, canned, or frozen)
- 1 can (31/2 oz) French fried onions
<|steps|>
In a 1½-quart casserole, stir cheddar cheese soup until smooth, then gradually add milk.
Mix in cooked green beans and half the can of French fried onions.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until bubbling.
Sprinkle remaining onions on top and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED APPLES WITH HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 apples, sliced
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 lb. ham slices
<|steps|>
Fry ham slices, remove from skillet.
Melt butter in skillet, add apples, sugar, and cinnamon.
Cook until apples are tender, serve with ham.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLOSSAL CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package active dry yeast or cake yeast
- 1/4 cup very warm water
- 2 cups milk, scalded
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup shortening
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, well-beaten
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 4 to 41/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
<|steps|>
Sprinkle yeast into very warm water in a measuring cup and stir until dissolved.
In a large mixing bowl, combine scalded milk, sugar, shortening, and salt; stir in 3 cups flour until blended.
Add eggs, yeast mixture, and corn meal; gradually stir in 4 cups flour.
On a lightly floured board, knead dough for 10 minutes until smooth and plastic, using remaining flour as needed.
Place dough in a large greased bowl, turning to grease all sides; cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place (85°F) for about 1½ hours or until doubled in size.
Grease two Pyrex loaf pans.
Turn dough onto a floured surface, knead for 1-2 minutes, shape into loaves, and place seam side down in pans.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 375°F (or 350°F for Pyrex) for 35-45 minutes.
Turn out to cool on their sides on a wire rack.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY APPLE RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. fresh cranberries
- 2 oranges, quartered and seeded
- 1 lemon, quartered and seeded
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 apples
<|steps|>
Put cranberries, oranges, and lemon through food chopper.
Add diced apples and sugar, blend well.
Chill thoroughly before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN MOUSSE GLACE**
<|ingredients|>
- Chicken mousse (your favorite recipe, with sufficient gelatin)
- Clear gelatin (Knox Gelatin recipe, using chicken consommé and lemon juice)
- Thin slices of raw potato, carrots, radishes, cucumber, for design
- Thin strips of spring onion tops, for stems
- Seasoned cream cheese, for design
<|steps|>
Prepare chicken mousse, ensuring enough gelatin for stiffness.
Oil the bottom and sides of a flat aluminum mold (e.g., small oblong roaster or bread pan).
Pour a thin layer of clear gelatin into the mold and partially set in the refrigerator.
Keep the mold in ice water while creating a design with sliced vegetables and cream cheese piped from a pastry tube.
Press design elements gently into the partially set gelatin and return to the refrigerator to complete setting.
Pour another thin layer of gelatin to seal the design and let it set.
Pour partially congealed chicken mousse into the mold and refrigerate until fully set.
Unmold carefully onto a serving dish and garnish with lettuce leaves and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERTHA'S SPICED CHOCOLATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup butter
- 3/4 cup milk
- 3/4 teaspoon cloves
- 1 3/4 cups sugar
- 2 tablespoons cocoa
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 4 eggs
- 2 cups cake flour (sifted before measuring)
- Caramel filling (recommended)
<|steps|>
Cream butter, add sugar, and beat until light and fluffy.
Add whole eggs, beating well after each addition.
Sift flour, baking powder, cocoa, cinnamon, and cloves together.
Add vanilla to milk.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beating until smooth.
Pour into two greased and floured 9-inch layer cake pans.
Bake at 375°F for 25-35 minutes.
Use caramel filling or your favorite filling.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1 tsp. unflavored gelatin
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- 1/4 cup. quartered maraschino cherries
- 1 drained No. 2 can crushed pineapple or 1 can fruit cocktail
- 1 banana
- 2 Tbsp. gelatin
- 3 oranges
- 1 cup. syrup, drained from crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. drained, crushed pineapple
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 lemon
- 1 small bottle red cherries
- 1 small bottle green cherries
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in measuring cup, set in boiling water, stir until dissolved.
Combine cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar, add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, pecans, cherries, pineapple or fruit cocktail, and banana.
Pour into ice cube tray, freeze until just firm.
Slice, serve on crisp lettuce.
**CONGEALED SALAD (RECIPE 2)**
Soak gelatin in 1/4 c. cold water, cut oranges in pieces, drain juice, add water to make 1/2 c.
Add pineapple syrup, bring juices to boiling point, add sugar and salt, cool.
Add lemon juice, orange pieces, pineapple, and cherries cut in pieces.
Mold, place in cool place to congeal.
Serve on lettuce with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEXAS HASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tablespoons fat
- 2 medium onions, sliced
- 1 green pepper, sliced
- 1 pound ground beef
- ¾ cup uncooked rice
- 1 can (No. 21/2) tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 bunches broccoli
- 2 tablespoons onion, chopped fine
- 21/2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 11/2 cups sour cream
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon vinegar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- Dash of pepper
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts
<|steps|>
Melt fat in a heavy skillet, then cook onions and green pepper until they begin to brown.
Add ground beef and stir until browned.
Add rice, tomatoes, salt, pepper, and chili powder.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
**BROCCOLI WITH SOUR CREAM SAUCE**
Trim and wash broccoli, then cook in boiling salted water until tender; drain.
For the sauce, melt butter in the top of a double boiler over hot water, add onion, and cook until soft.
Add sour cream, sugar, vinegar, salt, and pepper to the butter and onion; cook for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over broccoli and sprinkle with chopped peanuts to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3-oz package cream cheese
- 0.25 cup mayonnaise
- 0.67 cup whipping cream
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 0.75 cup chopped dates
- 0.75 cup crushed pineapple, drained
<|steps|>
Mash cream cheese and blend in mayonnaise.
Whip cream until stiff, add lemon juice, and fold in fruit and cheese mixture.
Pour into a freezing tray, optionally using cube partitions for individual servings.
Freeze until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS ENGLISH PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. asparagus tips
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
- 1 cup. English peas, drained
- 2 hard cooked eggs, sliced
<|steps|>
Make alternate layers of peas, asparagus and egg slices in a baking dish.
Add layer of soup last.
Top with cracker crumbs and dot with butter.
Bake in 350 degree oven until brown.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHESS CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 fresh cocoanut
- 2 cups sugar
- 0.67 pint water
- 0.5 lb butter
- 7 egg yolks
- Rich, unbaked pastry, for lining
- 1.25 coffee cups prepared cocoanut, if not fresh
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 4 tbsp boiling water
- Sherry, rum, or brandy flavoring, to taste
- Nutmeg, optional
<|steps|>
Peel and grate cocoanut if fresh.
Boil sugar in water for 15 minutes, stir in grated cocoanut, and boil 15 minutes longer.
While warm, stir in butter and well-beaten egg yolks.
Pour into patty pans or pie pans lined with rich, unbaked pastry.
Bake in a moderate oven until done, making 24 tiny pies or 2 large pies.
**HARD SAUCE**
Beat butter until creamy, then add half the sugar and 2 tbsp boiling water.
Beat well, then add remaining sugar and water.
When light and fluffy, add flavoring and optional nutmeg.
Store in a cool place until used.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DIVINITY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 egg whites
- 3.5 cups sugar
- 1 cup white corn syrup
- 1 cup nuts (or more)
- 1.5 cups water
- 2 tsp vanilla
- 4 egg whites
- 3.5 cups sugar
- 1 cup white corn syrup
- 1.5 cups water
- Oil of peppermint, to taste
- Food coloring, optional
<|steps|>
Cook 1 cup sugar and 0.5 cup water until it spins a thread, then pour over stiffly beaten egg whites and beat well.
Cook 2.5 cups sugar, 1 cup water, and corn syrup until very brittle in cold water.
Pour this syrup over the egg white mixture.
Add vanilla and nuts, beating until it holds its shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**MINTS**
Cook 1 cup sugar and 0.5 cup water until it spins a thread, then pour over stiffly beaten egg whites and beat well.
Cook 2.5 cups sugar, 1 cup water, and corn syrup until very brittle in cold water.
Pour this syrup over the egg white mixture.
Add a drop or two of oil of peppermint and optional food coloring, beating until it holds its shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BANANA CREAM PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 3 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 bananas, sliced
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Layer bananas in pie crust, pour custard over, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIVER DE LUXE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound calf's liver
- Flour, for dredging
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
- Butter, for browning
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 small can mushrooms
- 1/3 cup burgundy wine
<|steps|>
Dredge liver pieces with flour seasoned with salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Brown liver gently on both sides in butter.
Blend onion, mushrooms, and burgundy wine to make a sauce.
Pour sauce over liver and cook on very low heat for 25 minutes.
Place on a hot serving platter and top with the sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED CUSTARD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint milk
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 3 egg yolks
- 2 tsp flour
- 2 tsp cornstarch
- 1 tsp butter
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Crumbs, for coating
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- Deep fat, for frying
<|steps|>
Cook milk, sugar, egg yolks, flour, cornstarch, butter, and vanilla in a double boiler until thick.
Pour into a buttered 2-inch deep dish and chill overnight.
Cut custard into squares, dip in crumbs, then in slightly beaten egg, and back into crumbs.
Fry in deep fat and dry out in the oven.
Serve with broiled chicken.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME FRAPPE WITH MELON BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint can orange juice
- Cantaloupe balls
- Lime or wintergreen flavoring
- Green food coloring
- White rum
- Ginger ale
<|steps|>
Flavor orange juice with lime or wintergreen and color green.
Freeze to a mush, then whip in an electric mixer until smooth.
Return to the freezer until ready to serve.
Place in champagne saucer glasses, pour about 1 teaspoon white rum over the ice, and fill with ginger ale.
Place cantaloupe balls on a cocktail stick and lay across the top of each glass.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOMEMADE CHILI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 can red beans
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- 2 tbsp. cooking oil
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tbsp. onion, chopped
- 2 tbsp. green pepper, chopped
- 2 bay leaves
- dash tabasco sauce
- juice of 1/2 lemon
- 2 tbsp. Worcestershire
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 can water
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 can water
<|steps|>
Season meat and brown in Wesson oil.
Put in tomato paste and red beans and add about 3 cans of water.
Put in little sugar to keep tomato from tasting flat and chili powder to taste.
Makes from 4 to 6 servings.
**SPAGHETTI AND MEAT SAUCE**
Brown meat, pepper and onions in oil.
Add other ingredients and simmer slowly, about 2 hours.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions, drain thoroughly.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Fresh bread slices
- Finely ground cooked chicken
- Minced broiled mushrooms
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion, to taste
- Thickened chicken broth
<|steps|>
Trim edges from fresh bread slices.
Mix ground chicken, mushrooms, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and a hint of onion with enough thickened chicken broth to make a spread.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
