Roll each slice and secure with a toothpick if needed.
Optionally, store in a home freezer.
Toast in the oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 cups cooked chicken
- 5.25 cups mushrooms
- 1.75 cups pimento
- 21 tbsp chicken fat
- 21 tbsp flour
- 30 cups chicken stock
- 2 cups cream
- 7 egg yolks
- 1.75 cups blanched almonds
- 7 tbsp sherry (or more)
- 1 cup water
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup pastry flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 4 eggs
<|steps|>
Make sauce by adding flour to chicken fat, then chicken stock and cream.
When sauce is smooth and boiling, add well-beaten egg yolks.
Add chicken, mushrooms, pimento, almonds, and sherry.
Keep hot in a pan of hot water until served.
Serve in puffs (see below) for 30 people.
**PUFFS**
Heat water and butter in a saucepan until boiling.
Add flour and salt, stirring and cooking over a slow fire.
Add unbeaten eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 450°F for 15 minutes, then at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Cut puffs in half and fill with chicken a la king or creamed mixtures.
Heat in oven before serving, making 36-40 puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAND TARTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. self rising flour
- 1 1/2 cup. nuts, chopped
- 3/4 cup. powdered sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add flour, vanilla and nuts.
Form mixture into small fingers.
Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet in a 350 degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes.
Roll fingers in additional powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROILED HAMBURGERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion (optional)
<|steps|>
Mix beef, salt, pepper, and onion if using.
Shape into patties.
Broil 3-4 inches from heat for 5-7 minutes per side.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE AND BERRY ICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 oranges (grated rind)
- 2 cups berry juice
- 2 lemons (grated rind)
- 2 cups water
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix orange rind, berry juice, lemon rind, and water.
Sweeten to taste and freeze until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ALL BRAN MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. All-Bran cereal
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. melted shortening
<|steps|>
Mix cereal and milk, let stand 5 minutes.
Mix dry ingredients, add to cereal mixture with egg and shortening, stir until just mixed.
Pour into greased muffin tins.
Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WAIOLI DATE BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dates
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 21/4 cups quick rolled oats
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup butter, melted
<|steps|>
Cook dates, ½ cup brown sugar, water, and 1 tablespoon flour slowly until thick but soft; add vanilla and set aside.
Mix 1¾ cups flour, baking soda, oats, and 1 cup brown sugar; add melted butter to form a dry mixture.
Press half the dry mixture into a greased 8 x 8-inch pan.
Pour the date mixture over the dry layer.
Press the remaining dry mixture over the date layer.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHARLOTTE RUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pints rich milk
- 0.75 package gelatine
- 1 quart milk
- 1 lb sugar
- 8 egg yolks
- 1 quart rich cream, whipped
- Stale sponge cake, for lining
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in 2 pints milk.
Make a custard with 1 quart milk, sugar, and egg yolks in a double boiler until thick.
Add milk and gelatine, then cool.
When it begins to congeal, stir in whipped cream.
Line a large mold with stale sponge cake and pour in the mixture.
Set on ice to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Cake:**
- 1 box strawberry jello
- 1/2 cup hot water
- Juice from a 1-pound box of frozen strawberries
- 4 eggs
- 1 box white cake mix
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- Drained strawberries (from cake)
<|steps|>
**Cake:** Dissolve jello in hot water, then add strawberry juice and eggs.
Mix with white cake mix and beat according to package directions.
Pour into four 8 x 12-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
**Icing:** Combine oleo, confectioners' sugar, and drained strawberries; beat until spreadable.
Spread icing on cooled cake layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. crushed pineapple
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add pineapple, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and lemon juice, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with whipped cream.
**CARAMEL PIE (RECIPE 2)**
Mix brown sugar, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **THREE BEAN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) cut green beans, drained
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) lima beans, drained
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) kidney beans, drained
- 1 cup. diced peeled tomatoes
- 1 cup. sliced celery
- 1/2 cup. chopped sweet pickle
- French dressing
<|steps|>
Combine vegetables, pickle and enough dressing to moisten, toss lightly.
Chill.
10 to 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIENDSHIP SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon white pepper
- 2 tablespoons Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon salt
- Sprinkle of red pepper
- 1 teaspoon mixed mustard
- Olive oil or Wesson oil
- Vinegar, to taste
- 1 cup crushed fresh or frozen strawberries
- 1/2 cup butter
- 3 cups confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, paprika, white pepper, Worcestershire sauce, salt, red pepper, and mustard.
Add olive oil or Wesson oil 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly, until very thick.
Add a little vinegar to flavor.
**PURVIS'S STRAWBERRY HARD SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar together.
Add crushed strawberries.
Serve on top of waffles.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH SHRIMP SHELLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tbsp. butter or oleo
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- dash pepper
- 1/4 dry sherry
- 1 lb. sm., shelled, cooked shrimp
- grated parmesan cheese
- dash paprika
<|steps|>
Melt butter in saucepan, stir in flour.
Add milk, cook and stir until thickened.
Stir in salt, pepper, paprika, sherry and shrimp.
Pour into 5 baking shells.
Sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon parmesan cheese.
Place under broiler 3 or 4" from heat.
Broil till cheese browns.
Lobster or crab may be substituted for shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHOLE STRING BEANS AND MUSHROOMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can whole string beans
- 1 4-oz can mushroom stems and pieces
- Pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Margarine, to taste
<|steps|>
Pour beans into a saucepan; add pepper, salt, and margarine.
Bring to a simmer, add strained mushrooms, and cook for a few minutes, for 4-6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT CRUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup sugar
- 32 Ritz crackers, crushed
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Fold in sugar, crackers, pecans, and vanilla.
Pour into a greased 8x10-inch pan and press firmly.
Bake at 325°F for 25-30 minutes.
Cut into squares, for about 16 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FEUD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 21/2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 cups finely ground pecans (like meal)
- 3 cups whipped cream, sweetened (preferably with confectioners' sugar)
- Additional ground pecans for topping
<|steps|>
Separate eggs; beat yolks with a mixer for 5 minutes or by hand for 15 minutes.
Gradually add sugar, then flour and baking powder.
Stir in ground pecans, then fold in beaten egg whites.
Pour into two greased and lightly floured 8 x 8-inch pans.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
When cool, frost with sweetened whipped cream and sprinkle with ground pecans.
Refrigerate; keeps for several days.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SCALLOPED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cooked chicken, deboned
- 1 cup. chicken broth
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. melted butter
<|steps|>
Mix chicken, broth, bread crumbs, celery, onion, salt, and pepper.
Pour into greased casserole, drizzle with butter.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER ALE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon gelatin
- 2 tablespoons cold water
- 1/2 cup boiling water
- 1/2 cup ginger ale
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 4 tablespoons sugar
- 1/2 cup sliced peaches or pears
- 1/2 cup orange sections
- 1/2 cup fresh strawberries, sliced
- 1/4 cup grapes, halved, or 1/4 cup diced pineapple
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water, then add boiling water, ginger ale, lemon juice, and sugar; stir to dissolve.
Cool, then add peaches or pears, orange sections, strawberries, and grapes or pineapple.
Pour into a 1-quart mold or 8 (½-cup) individual molds; chill for 6-8 hours or overnight.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. SLATER'S MOLASSES PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint molasses
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Cook butter and molasses for 5 minutes.
Cream eggs and sugar, then pour in molasses, stirring constantly.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake in a slow oven until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT MACAROONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 egg whites
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until foamy, gradually add sugar and salt, beat until stiff peaks form.
Fold in vanilla and coconut.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 325°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINCEMEAT CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope (1 tablespoon) unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 (28 oz) jar mincemeat
- 3 egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 9-inch baked pie shell
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in water in a saucepan, then heat over low heat, stirring until dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in mincemeat; chill until the mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy, then gradually beat in sugar until stiff and glossy.
Fold mincemeat mixture into egg whites.
Pile into the baked pie shell and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN DESSERT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 marshmallows
- 0.25 cup pineapple juice
- 0.33 cup cream cheese (3 oz)
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup whipped cream
- 1 cup maraschino cherries
- 1 cup drained pineapple
- 1 cup drained peaches
<|steps|>
Soak marshmallows in pineapple juice for 30 minutes until soft.
Mash cream cheese until smooth, then stir in mayonnaise.
Mix with marshmallows and juice until creamy.
Fold in whipped cream, cherries, pineapple, and peaches.
Pour into a freezing tray and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Cut into squares and serve on lettuce, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. water
- 1 cup. sugar
- Pinch of salt
- Juice of small lemon
- Sweet potatoes (quantity not specified)
<|steps|>
Make syrup of water, sugar, salt, and lemon juice.
Cut potatoes lengthwise in quarters or eights, drop in boiling syrup, cook until tender, turning once or twice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ISABELLE'S OLD ENGLISH PLUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound seeded raisins
- 1/2 pound candied orange peel
- 1/2 pound candied citron peel
- 1/4 pound finely chopped beef suet
- 4 cups well-dried bread crumbs
- 1 cup fruit juice (cider, berry, or orange)
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 pound figs
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 6 eggs
- 1/2 cup flour
- Brandy, sherry, or rum, for flavoring
- 1/2 teaspoon mace
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 pound sultana raisins
- 1/2 pound candied lemon peel
<|steps|>
Mix all fruit together, then add suet and bread crumbs sprinkled with flour, salt, and spices.
Moisten with fruit juice mixed with brown sugar, then add flavoring and eggs.
Work thoroughly and let stand overnight to ripen.
Turn into molds or a pudding bowl and steam for 6 hours (less for smaller molds).
Serve, optionally with flaming snap-dragons (large raisins with brandy poured over, lit, and served ablaze).
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERMILK BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. buttermilk
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. mashed bananas
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped walnuts
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. molasses
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add buttermilk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into biscuits.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
**BANANA NUT BREAD (RECIPE 2)**
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and bananas.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in walnuts, pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
**GINGERBREAD**
Cream shortening and sugar, add egg and molasses.
Mix dry ingredients, add alternately with hot water to creamed mixture.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 yellow squash
- 1/2 cup. cooked ground beef
- 1/4 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. tomato sauce
<|steps|>
Cut squash in half, scoop out centers.
Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, salt, and pepper, stuff squash.
Place in baking dish, pour tomato sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PLANTER'S PLANTATION PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (46 oz) orange juice
- 1 can (46 oz) pineapple juice
- 1 quart ginger ale
- 1 quart lemon sherbet
<|steps|>
Chill the punch bowl and juices.
Place lemon sherbet in the punch bowl.
Add orange juice and pineapple juice, then pour in ginger ale last.
Stir gently and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 3 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
**POUND CAKE**
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, salt, and baking powder, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 325°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SELF-RISING ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
<|steps|>
Mix flour and sugar, cut in shortening.
Add milk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into rolls.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAUSAGE RING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds bulk sausage meat
- 11/2 cups cracker crumbs
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1/4 cup minced onion
- 1 cup finely chopped apple
- Scrambled or creamed eggs, fried or stewed apples, or creamed chicken for filling
- Broiled pineapple, peach halves, or apricots for garnish
<|steps|>
Mix sausage, cracker crumbs, eggs, onion, and apple in the order given.
Form into a ring in a shallow baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, then drain fat from the pan.
Fill the center with scrambled or creamed eggs, fried or stewed apples, or creamed chicken.
Garnish with broiled pineapple, peach halves, or apricots.
Note: Can be prepared and baked for half the time the day before, then complete baking at serving time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TIPSY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1.125 cups flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 tbsp cold water
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 0.33 tsp salt
- Grated rind of 0.5 lemon
- 4 cups milk
- 4 eggs
- 8 tbsp sugar
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1.5 cups blanched almonds
- 12 tbsp whiskey or sherry
- Whipped cream, for topping
<|steps|>
Separate 3 eggs, beat yolks with sugar, add water, lemon rind, and flour sifted twice with baking powder and 0.33 tsp salt.
Fold in beaten egg whites, pour into a greased 9-inch square pan, and bake at 320°F until done.
Heat 4 cups milk, combine 4 eggs, 8 tbsp sugar, and 0.5 tsp salt, and stir into hot milk.
Cook over hot water until custard coats a spoon, add vanilla, and chill.
Split cake into two layers, stick almonds into each cut side, using half the nuts per layer.
Sprinkle one layer with half the whiskey, pour over half the chilled custard.
Place the second layer almond-side up, sprinkle with remaining whiskey, and pour over remaining custard.
Top with a thick layer of whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. peanut butter
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 1/2 cup. gran. sugar
- 1 cup. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1 egg, well beaten
<|steps|>
Cream peanut butter and shortening together.
Add sugar gradually, continuing until mixture is light and fluffy.
Add beaten egg.
Sift flour and soda together, add, mix well.
Drop mixture by teaspoons on cookie sheet.
Press down with tines of a fork.
Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEACH SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small box raspberry jello
- 2 cups water (minus 2 tablespoons), boiling
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 6 peach halves
<|steps|>
Dissolve jello in boiling water, add vinegar, and let stand until cool.
Place peach halves upside down in an 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan, pour jello over, and chill until firm.
Serve on lettuce leaves with salad dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. grated carrots
- 2 cup. plain flour
- 1 1/2 cup. Wesson oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 heaping tsp. soda
- 1 8-oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. chopped toasted pecans
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box conf. sugar
<|steps|>
Sift flour, salt, soda, cinnamon and sugar together.
Beat eggs slightly, add oil and carrots.
Add flour mixture.
Pour into 2 greased, floured pans.
Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees.
**FROSTING**
Cream cheese and butter, add sugar and flavoring.
Spread on layers and sides.
Sprinkle pecans on top and in between layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2.5 can fruit cocktail
- 1 tsp unflavored gelatin
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 3-oz pkg cream cheese
- 0.25 cup mayonnaise
- Dash salt
- 0.66 cup whipping cream, chilled
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Drain fruit cocktail.
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then dissolve over hot water.
Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise and salt; stir in gelatin.
Whip cream until stiff, gradually adding sugar.
Fold in cheese mixture, nuts, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a waxed paper-lined refrigerator tray and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Slice and garnish with watercress, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 4 bananas
- 1 pkg. dates
- 1/2 lb. grapes
- 1/4 lb. marshmallows
- 1 cup. pineapple juice
- Juice of 1 orange
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 eggs, well beaten
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, bananas, dates, grapes, and marshmallows.
Make dressing: combine pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, cornstarch, and eggs, cook slowly until thick.
Cool dressing, pour over fruits.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICED GRAPES OR MUSCADINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 5 lbs grapes or muscadines
- 0.75 cup water
- 2.5 lbs sugar
- 2 tbsp cinnamon
- 2 tbsp allspice
- 0.5 tbsp ground cloves
- 0.5 cup vinegar, to taste
<|steps|>
Wash and pulp grapes.
Boil skins with water until tender.
Cook pulps in their own juice until seeds can be removed through a colander.
Mix skins and pulps, then add sugar, cinnamon, allspice, cloves, and vinegar.
Boil, stirring occasionally, until rather thick.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI AND BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. bag red kidney beans
- 1 lb. hamburger meat
- 1 medium onion
- 4 Tbsp. shortening
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 Tbsp. garlic salt
- Salt and pepper
<|steps|>
Soak beans in hot water for 2-3 hours, wash, cook in fresh hot water until tender.
Add diced onion, chili powder, and 1 Tbsp. garlic salt.
Brown meat in shortening, add 1 Tbsp. garlic salt while browning.
Add meat mixture to beans, add salt and pepper to taste, simmer until very thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY BAKED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (1 pound) pork and beans
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons catsup
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- Dash of black pepper
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Bake in a shallow baking dish at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLDED EGG AND CAVIAR SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- Pinch of mustard
- 1 oz jar caviar
- Juice of 0.5 lemon
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Mayonnaise, for serving
- Anchovy, for topping
<|steps|>
Chop eggs in a grinder.
Combine with butter, mustard, caviar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pack tightly in small molds or demi-tasse cups and chill overnight.
Unmold and serve on a slice of tomato on shredded lettuce.
Cover with mayonnaise and top with a rolled anchovy.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PORK SAUSAGE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- Regular biscuit dough
- Pork sausage
<|steps|>
Prepare regular biscuit dough and shape into tiny biscuits.
Bake until golden brown.
Fry sausage into tiny cakes.
Place one sausage cake in each biscuit and serve piping hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 cup brown corn syrup
- 2 cups pecans
- 0.5 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- Unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Mix butter, sugar, eggs, flour, and corn syrup well.
Add pecans, vanilla, and salt.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALLY LUNN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint milk
- 1 cake yeast
- 1 heaping tbsp butter
- 1 heaping tbsp shortening
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 0.75 cup sugar
- 1 quart flour
- 1 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Warm milk and dissolve yeast.
Add butter, shortening, eggs, sugar, flour, and salt; mix until smooth.
Let rise until double in bulk.
Stir down and let rise again.
Bake in a loaf pan in a moderate oven.
Serve hot with butter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- ¾ cup sugar
- 3 tablespoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 3 tablespoons shortening, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt; add chopped nuts and set aside.
Beat eggs until frothy, then add milk, vanilla, and cooled melted shortening.
Stir dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just blended.
Pour into a well-greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove and cool completely before slicing.
Slice thinly and spread with softened butter, cream cheese, or apricot jam.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MANDARIN ORANGE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans mandarin oranges
- 1 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 pint sour cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Store in the refrigerator overnight.
Serve on lettuce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROSTED COFFEE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup iced coffee
- 1/2 pint vanilla ice cream
- 1 cup milk
<|steps|>
Combine iced coffee, vanilla ice cream, and milk in a cocktail shaker.
Shake thoroughly and serve in tall glasses.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG PLANT AND STUFFED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant (2 lbs)
- 1 can tomatoes
- 2 cups chopped onions
- 1 small can tomato paste (if needed)
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 1/2 cup chopped green peppers
- 2 cups chopped celery
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Grated cheese, as needed
- Broiled buttered shrimp, for garnish
- Chopped parsley, for garnish
- 4 medium yellow squash
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 finely chopped onion
- 1/2 cup cooked chopped celery
- Grated chicken liver (optional)
- 2 tablespoons cream
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
**Eggplant:**
- Wash and dry eggplant, cut off a thin lengthwise slice, and scoop out the inside, leaving a 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick wall.
- Sprinkle salt inside the shell and set in water.
- Cut eggplant flesh into pieces, cover with water, add a little salt, and cook until tender. Drain.
- Cook onions, celery, and green peppers in bacon drippings until they begin to brown.
- Add tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes, then add tomato soup (and tomato paste if needed). Cook slowly until thick.
- Add chopped eggplant and season highly to taste with Worcestershire, salt, and pepper.
- Fill eggplant shells with alternating layers of eggplant mixture and grated cheese, topping with cheese.
- Bake until the cheese is golden brown.
- Garnish with broiled buttered shrimp dipped in chopped parsley, placed in each scallop around the eggplant.
**Squash:**
- Halve squash lengthwise, careful not to break the neck, and scoop out seeds.
- Place shells in water with 1/2 cup water and 1 teaspoon salt, and cook until tender.
- Drain squash and mash the flesh.
- In a skillet, melt butter, add finely chopped onion, and cook until it begins to brown.
- Add mashed squash, cooked celery, black pepper, and 2 tablespoons cream. Season to taste.
- Fill squash shells with the mixture, sprinkle with grated cheese and paprika.
- Bake until heated through. Serves 6 to 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups tomato juice
- 2 envelopes gelatin
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- Onion juice, to taste
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 chopped avocado
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped stuffed olives
- 1 1/2 cups cottage cheese
- Mayonnaise, to taste
- Horseradish, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup finely chopped spring onion
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped pepper
- 1 grated cucumber (unpeeled, juice drained)
- Durkee's dressing, for marinating
- Artichoke hearts, for serving
- Avocado slices, for serving
<|steps|>
Boil tomato juice with salt, sugar, lemon juice, Worcestershire, onion juice, and Tabasco.
Dissolve gelatin in 1/2 cup water, cool, and add to the tomato juice mixture.
Stir in chopped avocado, celery, and stuffed olives.
Pour into a ring mold and refrigerate until set.
For the cheese center, cream cottage cheese with mayonnaise, horseradish, salt, and pepper.
Add chopped spring onion, celery, pepper, and drained grated cucumber.
Marinate artichoke hearts and avocado slices in Durkee's dressing.
Serve the aspic on lettuce with the cheese mixture in the center, garnished with artichoke hearts and avocado slices.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FILLING FOR CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1 cup. pecans, chopped
- 1 can angel flake coconut
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. sweet milk
- 1 tbsp. flour
- 1 stick butter, soft
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 box conf. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 tbsp. cream
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients and cook until thick enough to spread between layers.
**FROSTING**
Mix butter, eggs, vanilla and cream.
Beat together add sugar until of right consistency to spread on top and sides of cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TRANSPARENT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 3 eggs
- Pastry, for pie tin
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add eggs one at a time, beating thoroughly.
Add nutmeg.
Line a pie tin with pastry, pour in custard.
Bake in a slow 250°F oven for 1.5 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARY AGNES'S CHEESE PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 slices white bread
- 2 cups grated cheese
- 4 eggs
- 1/3 cup butter
- 3 cups milk
- 1 1/3 teaspoons salt
- 1/3 teaspoon dry mustard
<|steps|>
Spread bread slices with butter and cut each into 4 pieces.
In a baking dish, alternate layers of cheese and bread, ending with cheese on top.
Combine milk, slightly beaten eggs, salt, and dry mustard.
Pour the mixture over the cheese and bread.
Bake at 325°F for approximately 40 minutes. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED RIBS**
<|ingredients|>
- Spare ribs
- Butter, for greasing
- 1 cup vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 0.33 cup catsup
- 1 lb butter
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, optional
- 6 quail
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp flour
- 6 strips bacon
- 0.5 cup hot water
- Chopped parsley, for serving
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Grease ribs with butter and warm in an oven or on the stove slowly.
Boil vinegar, water, catsup, butter, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over browned ribs.
Bake in a 350°F oven for about 1.25 hours, basting and turning frequently until done.
Optionally, cook over charcoal burners for a superior barbecue.
**QUAIL**
Pick, draw, and clean quail, then split down the back.
Rub each bird with butter, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and flour.
Wrap with bacon strips and place in a large skillet or roasting pan.
Cook under a broiler until well browned, turning frequently.
Add hot water, cover, and bake in a moderate oven until tender.
Serve on toast, sprinkled with chopped parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARBLE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Divide batter, mix cocoa and hot water, add to half the batter.
Spoon both batters into greased pan, swirl, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup melted butter
- 0.5 cup flour
- 0.25 cup pecans
- 0.25 cup boiling water
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt cocoa and butter, then add sugar.
Beat eggs and add to mixture.
Mix flour and pecans, then add boiling water and vanilla.
Pour into a greased pie pan.
Bake at 325°F for 30 minutes until firm.
Serve with ice cream or whipped cream, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE-STRAWBERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pt. strawberries
- 1/2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 3/4 cup. pineapple, sweetened if fresh
- 1/3 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/3 cup. whipped cream
- Sugar (to taste)
- Nut meats (optional)
<|steps|>
Sprinkle berries with lemon juice and sugar, add well-drained pineapple.
Arrange on lettuce, top with dressing of mayonnaise and whipped cream.
Add nut meats if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUE'S PARADISE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 boxes marshmallows
- 1 pint whipped cream
- 1/2 teaspoon mustard
- 1 tablespoon vinegar
- 1 large can pineapple
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon flour
<|steps|>
Mix egg yolks, mustard, vinegar, salt, sugar, and flour.
Cook in a double boiler until thick, then cool slightly.
Thin with whipped cream.
Chop marshmallows and pineapple, then add to the mixture.
Refrigerate to cool (do not freeze).
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MY FAVORITE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 cup. cooked green beans
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion in skillet.
Add soup and green beans, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with mashed potatoes and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ROBERTA'S CONSOMMÉ RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 cup finely chopped onions
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 2 cans consommé
<|steps|>
Wash and drain rice.
Melt butter in a skillet, add onions, and cook until slightly browned.
Add rice and cook over medium heat until browned, stirring to prevent burning.
Add consommé and transfer to an earthen casserole.
Cover tightly and bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Serves 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEAFOOD MEDLEY IN CUCUMBER RING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages lime gelatin
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 cup pineapple juice
- 1/4 cup vinegar
- 2 cups grated cucumber
- 1 cup finely diced unpeeled cucumber
- 1 pound crab meat
- 1 pound lobster meat
- 1 pound shrimp
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 2 tablespoons grated onion
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- Dash of paprika
- 1/2 cup prepared mustard
- 1/2 cup light cream
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup lemon juice
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin, salt, and sugar in hot water, then add pineapple juice, vinegar, and grated cucumber; chill until slightly thickened.
Lightly salt diced cucumber and fold into thickened gelatin.
Pour into a 1½-quart ring mold and congeal.
For the seafood medley, combine crab meat, lobster meat, shrimp, celery, grated onion, salt, pepper, and paprika; toss together.
For the dressing, combine mustard, light cream, granulated sugar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper; beat with a rotary beater until light and fluffy.
Dress the seafood medley with the dressing and fill the center of the cucumber ring.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE PEANUT BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup light corn syrup
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- Dash of salt
- 1 cup peanut butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 cups crisp rice cereal
- 1 cup corn flakes, crushed
- 1 (6 oz) package semi-sweet chocolate pieces
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn syrup, and salt in a saucepan; bring to a full boil.
Stir in peanut butter and remove from heat.
Stir in vanilla, rice cereal, corn flakes, and chocolate pieces.
Press into a buttered 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Chill for about 1 hour.
Cut into small bars or squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (3-pound) fryer or hen
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil or oleo
- ¾ cup celery, chopped
- 1 cup bell pepper, chopped
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 can chicken broth
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Spaghetti (quantity not specified, cook as needed)
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook in a small amount of water until tender, then cool and bone, cutting into small pieces.
Sauté celery, onions, and bell pepper in cooking oil or oleo.
Add cream of chicken soup and chicken broth, then let simmer.
Add boned chicken to the mixture.
Cook spaghetti as usual and drain.
In a greased 2-quart casserole, layer spaghetti and chicken mixture.
Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 baking size chicken
- 2 slices bacon
- 1 cup. onions
- 1 green pepper
- 2 or 3 stems of celery
- 2 cup. tomatoes or juice
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- Pepper and salt to taste
<|steps|>
Boil or steam chicken until tender. Remove chicken from broth and remove bones and cool.
Fry bacon until crisp. Remove from pan; into drippings add chopped onion and pepper and celery.
Crumble bacon back into mixture.
Add tomatoes, pepper, and salt.
Steam at 10 pounds of pressure for 15 minutes or simmer in covered saucepan for 45 minutes.
Add chicken that has been shredded fine.
Cook spaghetti in chicken broth.
Serve hot with sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COAHOMA STYLE EGGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can deviled ham
- 1 can mushrooms
- 1/2 cup butter
- 20 stuffed hard-boiled eggs
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Mayonnaise, to taste
- Stuffed olives, to taste
- Mustard, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Chili powder, to taste
- Garlic, to taste
- 2 teaspoons flour
<|steps|>
Prepare stuffed eggs by mixing mayonnaise, chopped stuffed olives, mustard, and paprika to taste with the egg yolks.
In a double boiler, combine deviled ham, mushrooms, butter, tomato soup, grated cheese, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, chili powder, and garlic.
Thicken the sauce with 2 teaspoons flour and cook until thickened.
Place two halves of stuffed eggs in a scallop shell.
Cover with the sauce and sprinkle liberally with grated cheese.
Heat in the oven for 5 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOBSTER ROUNDS**
<|ingredients|>
- Sandwich bread
- Freshly boiled lobster meat (1 can)
- Thick white sauce
- 1 egg yolk, beaten
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Dry sherry, to taste
- Grated cheese
<|steps|>
Cut sandwich bread into small circles (1 1/4 inches in diameter).
Shred lobster meat and mix with enough thick white sauce to hold together.
Add beaten egg yolk and season with salt, pepper, and dry sherry.
Pile the lobster mixture on the bread rounds and dust with grated cheese.
Toast in a moderate oven or broil until the cheese is browned.
Optionally, freeze before toasting.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOW-CHOW PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gallons cabbage, chopped
- 1 quart onions, chopped
- 1 cup salt
- 1 gallon vinegar
- 4 lbs brown sugar
- 5 tbsp mustard
- 2 scant tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp ground cloves
- 1.5 tbsp turmeric
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 1.5 cups white mustard seed
<|steps|>
Combine cabbage, onions, and salt; let stand overnight.
Drain in the morning and add vinegar, brown sugar, mustard, black pepper, cloves, turmeric, celery seed, and mustard seed.
Cook for about 2 hours.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>
